vujcrxI4vD6QrTIZrZgH5g.text: This is a hole in the wall type joint. It isn't sexy, but if you want a burger in Charlotte you have to go to Fran's Filling Station. I am not kidding it is the best burger I have ever eaten, so juicy and succulent with delicious toppings. Their burgers are so good I have yet to try any other entree when I go because I am craving the burger. The Bacon wrapped tater tots with the maple glaze are ridic amazing, and the pan fried corn nuggets with goat cheese ranch are equally as incredible. It is a little more expensive, but not outrageous. This is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte.

kTr2m4MW13yC7lnVhHb-sw.text: Fran definitely deserves FIVE stars-but bless her, her servers brought her way down.   Fran greeted me and seated me while I waited for my friend to arrive. She was so very friendly! We had a server in training who quite honestly shouldn't get the job-but Fran took care of us. She stopped to chat a few times while we were waiting on food and then after it had came. I got the sloppy burger with a side of their homemade fries and goatcheese ranch. SUPERB and hit the spot. Those pretzel rolls? THE BOMB! My friend ordered a French burger that came with tomatoes and melted brie... it was out of this world!  I have heard nothing but good things about Fran's-and I have nothing but good things to say. I cannot WAIT to try there again-and will hopefully have a better experience with a now trained server :)  She has specials, and of course-the burgers. I was floored. I could only eat half of mine but every bite was divine, cheesy and meaty goodness. Ahhhhhh. Oh-and the tea was so deliciously strong, perfect on a warm and sunny afternoon!

MdZq_xDqaELpzJfuqEX_dA.text: Service is awful. When we arrived there were plenty of tables.  By the time we were FINALLY able to leave, many of the tables were filled and EVERYONE was waiting for either food, more drinks or their check.  The food was so-so. Certainly not worth a special trip.  The beer menu is minimal and the drafts are overpriced.  We never did get the drinks we ordered.  Took us two hours to wait for our food, then wait for our check, then wait for the server to run our cards.  There are many other local restaurants with quality food and much better service - I would not recommend Fran's to any of my friends.

C864faGgsvE4TGlkE6uNyg.text: Excellent service, delicious food, and awesome atmosphere! A great place for a good meal and glass of wine on a Friday night! We love this treasure in Charlotte!

QLC9dIKV6Tpwf9o1sj0KFg.text: Fran is a terrible person.  I was hired to work for her in the kitchen and bent over backwards to help her in any way i could for about a month.  When i got my first paycheck (the day i quit, and a month after starting) i realized i was being paid less than was agreed upon, and her account was at "high risk" of being used fraudulently.  I quit that day because i am concerned as to her ability to be a dependable source of income.    Furthermore, i would not eat at this restaurant.  The kitchen area is repugnant.  Unless i was working, anything sliced on the deli slicer or french fry press was probably despicable, and the dishes are likely not much better.  Most temperature sensitive items (especially salad dressings) are kept out at all times during service, making them very hazardous, and Fran herself abhors having to turn around and get them out of the cooler (we also reused them way longer than we are supposed to, ie. a Russian dressing bottle was held for the entire month i worked there, and not replaced once). Worst of all, when those tater tots you all love so much, begin to mold over in the bag, she just tells you to pick out any moldy ones and get rid of them and use any that didn't look too bad...   Fran is a heartless woman, who cares as little about you the customer as she does about the people working for her.  She's in the business of making money, and doesnt care who she puts in harms way to make it.

-U5Z0wSlzo4E51E60tms8w.text: Good lunch spot.  Build your own:  salads, sandwiches, and mac n' cheese (goat cheese and bacon mac n cheese, for example).  Obviously the bacon wrapped tots.  Lots of healthy options,too, if grease isn't your thing.  I'm a fan of the Latin Wedge salad, but, like a previous reviewer pointed out, adding chicken or other protein to your salad significantly bumps up the cost....pushing it past a typical lunch price point for me.  The Lemon Chicken Salad sandwich is great - a perfect sandwich for the summer.  I almost feel like they're trying too hard with the menu, though.  Presentation/execution both struggle a little.  Service is always friendly, but the staff frequently seems a little overworked.  Not atypical from other small restaurants, I guess.  Not much consistency in server speed either.  Overall, a good, but not necessarily great lunch joint.

sZpg6aJQod5TSdrqVA9JPg.text: I ate at Fran's last night for the first time. What an excellent experience! The atmosphere, service and food was all top notch! Eva was our server, and she did an excellent job taking care of us, sharing her opinions when asked and she was very friendly. I ordered the California Burger and frites, which was one of the best burgers I've ever had. We also got their bacon wrapped tater tot appetizer and it was phenomenal! All 5 of us there completely finished every single bite on all our plates! I can't say enough good about Fran's. So glad we stumbled upon it!

ANfJYMuWrqZziWotI0avNA.text: I have been looking for a place like this for a long time!!  It's the type of restaurant that you can go to anytime with anyone.  Casual Atmosphere with unique decor (i wasnt crazy about the walk-in fridge in the middle of the secondary dining area) kinda strange! Cool kitschy-cowgirl decor. FOOD was amazing!  You must try the tater tot appetizer.  Nothing like the Ore-Ida tots!  These were morsels of sweet potato, wrapped in bacon and then glazed with a jalapeno sweet glaze!  Holy *%#@!   Mussels with a coconut curry sauce were also good ... but nothing to brag about. The daily special was "shrimp & grits". So we gave it a try. Highly recommended! Perfectly cooked shrimp with gouda cheese grits.   Then we finished it with their bread pudding... It was huge and delish!

gdX4AFsShJnLDKzr9CksZw.text: Would love to rate the food...but never got any (except for cold, crusty bread that seemed to have been soaked in olive oil).  Showed up at 6:45 on Saturday night with a reservation. After ordering food and getting our drinks we never saw our waiter again except for a "drive-by" ("Everything OK here?" As he ran by without waiting for an answer.) After an hour with no food and no drinks past the first round I got up and went to the bar to pay for the drinks and left. While we were there we saw several waiter-less tables, including one with a dude who went to the bar to get a beer for himself since no one came his table to ask if he needed another drink.  Based on other reviews, it appears Fran's never got their act together. There are WAY too many restaurants in Charlotte (and Dilworth) to put up with this. Terrible start to the weekend.  To paraphrase Keyshawn, "COME ON, FRAN!"  Won't be back.

1sIghFJccxJeSCOIEejzxg.text: Fran (the owner) seems to pride herself on humiliating her customers and being a tyrant to her employees. My husband and I sat at the bar - he ordered a hamburger. A simple request to add A PIECE OF LETTUCE to his burger elicited a frightened/horrified look from the waitress who had to ask FRAN for permission.   PERMISSION WAS DENIED. FRAN abruptly approached and with a smirking look and bad attitude corrected us that this was not the way her burgers were prepared.  She acted as though this simple request was the "impossible dream". Condescendingly, She attempted to put my husband "in his place" and educate him on why this "over the top" lettuce request was not going to happen.  YES, she had the lettuce but NO, it did not belong on THAT BURGER!   This restaurant would be much better off from a customer service perspective if it were called FRANK'S FILLING STATION.  We Will Not be back to spend another dime until the ownership changes.  Food was o.k - nothing special.

lpHRk4GbW87MwWOkgKjJCw.text: We went in to try something new. Heard great things and were excited for a night together. We asked the lady at the door for a table in the back, something dim and romantic ... And she sat us in front of the plate glass window up front. I repeated my request and she walked away.  It looks like a fun place for regulars, but we just sat there feeling left out of the party. Hospitality was really lacking, server did his best, but seemed overwhelmed with three tables. Someone who I assumed was Fran came by (didn't introduce herself) and asked how things were. We mentioned that things were a little slow and we had a problem with one of the apps ... She just smiled and nodded and walked off. I don't think she heard a word I said. Kind of distracted. We got a glass of wine, and wanted a second, but it never arrived. We were charged for it anyway. Would have complained, but by the time the check came, we just couldn't wait to leave.  We tried several different apps, none of which arrived hot. The bacon tots were flavorless ... A real shame, because the premise was so promising. We shared the crab cakes for entree, very small, soggy and buried under carrot shavings.  The TV over the bar was tuned to the food network. What was playing there looked much more appetizing than anything that came to our table.  Perhaps things are different for lunch, or for the regulars. I'm sad to report we won't find out.

4-wmI5yao750OCwMQsWvlw.text: Great food, great atmosphere, good wine! I had the meatballs with orzo and wedge salad and my friend had the burger. All were fantastic!! The staff was super attentive and when we were done they threw in a giant piece of carrot cake on the house. It was worth every calorie!! I'll absolute be back for more.

YsjqdW2ggI-ineaeOh5peA.text: Fran really filled me up good. Lounging around the apartment after a wine tasting with Adam R. and waiting for Peter E. to get home got us really hungry and Fran's food really hit the spot.  The space is cozy and warm, though if you get seated in front of the door during the colder months be prepared for periodic blasts of cold from people walking in! I decided to put my diet restrictions aside for this visit to taste those crispy delicious bacon wrapped tater tots! I'm a fan of the jalapeno glaze on the sweet potato tots definitely, not too hot and seasoned quite nicely. The bacon overwhelms the taste of both the sweet potato and regular a bit though. Maybe make a regular version of the appetizer?  After this came the glorious entrees. I got the eggplant parm and that thing is ginormous! I was content and full by halfway through. The sauces and cheesiness were bold and flavorful with lots of thick slices of eggplant throughout the bowl. Yummy! I find it curious though that the dish comes with 2 slices of the olive oil grilled bread, but if you order an extra basket it doesn't come with any.  The service is where it sadly falls a bit short. I was really lacking a water refill towards the end of my meal, especially since I chose such a salty app and entree. Also I'm not sure if our waiter heard me but I wanted the olive oil grilled bread I ordered to come out at the beginning of the meal but hey whatever it made a nice accompaniment to my entree. He was kind of awkward and standoffish but thankfully left us mostly alone.  It's just these little inconsistencies that keep me from giving Fran a 5 star review sadly along with their serious lack of vegetarian friendly options. For delicious casual dining options near my house though I'll keep coming back.

jR_pWFH5j0jAL-cektKHbQ.text: If I was rating on the food alone, I would have given this place much higher. The jalapeno wrapped sweet potato tots were perfectly caramelized and delicious with just enough of a kick. The buffalo chicken sandwich was on one of the most terrific pretzel rolls I've ever had with really tasty and savory sauce and what I assume to be homemade fancy mayo spread. Everyone's food looked wonderful, and when they were done plates looked pretty empty.  The first thing that put me off though is that this place seems to have a bit of an identity crisis going on. The name suggests a simple, laid back, friendly local place without many frills. I certainly didn't expect a place where if I wanted fries with my burger I'd have to order them a la carte....but you do. Additionally, I'm not sure what mood the decor is trying to set - there's some old west elements, some items that suggest european travel, and then some items that are antique-like. What? Yeah. So, out the gate: the atmosphere is a no go for me, and it's pricier than expected, so, wah wah. And the friendly part? Well, I kind of felt like we were strangers crashing the party. No one was outwardly rude, but I felt like they were all stealing glances at the unfamiliar people in the dining area.  Before our drink order could be taken, two of the waitstaff were bickering - in front of us - over who would take our table. I can't blame them really, the place was dead on a Saturday night. I'd fight for a table too if I was a waitress there. After that service was more professional, however refills on my soda were pretty slow and hard to come by, which just so happens to be something I can't stand. When I paid my $19 and change bill with two 20s, the waiter apologized but said he didn't have any change so I could leave a tip. Seriously? You're nearing the end of the night and don't have a ten and two fives? Whathuck??  I think maybe this is a great hang out for the local regulars, but we just felt a little out of place. I MAY go back in the future (with exact change!) and reassess since now at least I know what to expect because as I said, the food WAS good, but trust me, I won't be tripping over myself to make it happen.

CX7WTD-DWtdyecrecdAilQ.text: Where to go when Big  Daddy's line is out the door but you have a serious hankering for some delicious fries? - Frans!   Too bad for me they were out of them even though they were described by our server as "award winning" ..and they looked so good on our neighbors plate : ( Our server did her best to try and please me and even brought out both the chips and potato salad as my side...I did say I was in the mood for something fried and delicious - but they wouldn't do tater tots at lunch...I'm not quite sure why that is.  For my sandwich I went with the servers recommendation and opted for the chicken salad. Wow lemon aioli is amazing on chicken salad- and I have to say this is one of the best (if not the best) one I have had the pleasure of trying! The potato salad is a bit bland...but I am finicky about this as my mom makes the absolute best. The chips weren't homemade as I expected but rather bagged. They were tasty but really if you're a restaurant  you have no business serving packaged sides, in my opinion. (this isn't subway)   5 stars for food and service -1 star for the chips and because I know those tater tots are back there...and who runs out of fries anyway?

jGeHr2lsXB7ig8dlyKIARQ.text: This is a comforting place that serves comforting food. I love Fran, and her attention to detail. This is a neighborhood spot for me, and I am a regular.  I've never had a service issue, but I would say that if I did, I would ask to speak to the manager to give them an opportunity to fix it. I usually have dinner here 2-3 times a month.   On to the food...the tots are what my husband reserves for his reward after a ten mile run. Apparently they are that good. I'm a limited meat eater, and usually find options or ask for a menu modification, which has never been a problem. Many appetizer portions, especially the goat cheese bread, are large enough for a main. The Latin wedge has maybe the best salad dressing in this solar system.  The fried chicken sandwich is great, and has 2 chicken breasts.  I happen to love the Spicy Sprinkle for the heat and dimension it brings to her fries.   She has great wine specials during the week, and usually something fun or special on the drink menu for the weekend. Lots of her ingredients are local and organic and meals are well priced. Bottom line-cozy and comfortable, excellent food for an excellent price.

ksGwV1rioDfkByWwjzhksQ.text: One of my favorite places in Charlotte--great homey tasty food.  I think their burgers (on a pretzel roll) are moist and delicious, and their baseball-sized meatballs (gooey, of course) are fantastic.  It's a great atmosphere, has friendly staff, and I don't think I've ever had a meal there I haven't completely enjoyed, including the bacon-wrapped tots, their salads, and their chicken milanese (although I think $15 is a little pricey for a chicken cutlet, the quality can't be beat).  I'm a FB friend, and Fran's is always posting unique and delicious-sounding specials.  If I ate out more, I would be a more regular patron!  Good wine/beer list too.  One of my local favorites!

yYwWSowJxu5xKEGkOqm-Qw.text: Exercise all week.  Bank up those calories.  Go to Fran's. Eat bacon-wrapped tater tots, corn bites, and bread pudding.  Feel reaaaal good.   Seriously.   Went for RW, and had to go back two days later with friends, it was that delish.  Part of what makes Fran's so appealing, is how laid-back it is.  Casual, but the food is well thought out like it is at more upscale eateries. (Can't stand dressing up for a good meal when you don't want to!)  Standouts:   -- Bacon wrapped tater tots.  You'll get two kinds, served skewered and propped up in a little cone-shaped wire basket. They're deep fried for extra crispness and the bacon's glazed with sweetness. NOMNOMNOM!  -- Corn nuggests. Asian restaurants have corn croquettes and corn nugget like dishes, and this one is light, but rich and creamy. It comes with a creamy goat cheese ranch dipping sauce, adding to the decadence. The goat cheese added a nice tang too.   Salads-- either the Greek or Latin wedge, I had both.  Flavorful, and fresh, you can tell the dressings aren't bottled preservative JUNK.   The mains, I wasn't so floored by, but they were good.  Let's just skip to dessert.   The bread pudding is sweet and rich and caramel-y...the coconut cake is dotted with big juicy blackberries.  If I didn't have manners, I would just eat the entire thing without utensils, and just do a face-plant in the dessert.   It's that good.

aDOQWLbLURyCLkaBHgC3hA.text: I would relate my first experience at Fran's to the feeling you get when you find a $20 bill in your coat from the previous winter. Living in the shadow of Ru Sans, this place is easily overlooked but undeservedly so!   Walking in, you are immediately presented with a small and warmly decorated room. On the left side is a full service bar and the right houses 15-20 tables, about 2/3rds of which were occupied at my arrival. Beyond the front room is another smaller area which is open to the kitchen and walk in fridge, definitely a tad eccentric but adds to the casual ambiance of the place.   My guest and I were promptly seated in the front room and asked for drink orders. For all of you soda-shoppe-esque ice lovers, Fran's got it. Her diverse menu boasts everything from burgers and pasta dishes to her allegedly famous bacon-wrapped tater tots. No, I did not mis-type, she actually has bacon-wrapped tater tots... Love at first sight? Maybe. I ordered the tots, a meatloaf entree and a side of mac and cheese.   The food took its time coming out, but I barely noticed. Neither did my guest. It's hard to place a finger on it, but something about Fran's unique atmosphere allows for a dining experience that makes you want to spend hours there, and I am usually the patron who likes to be in and out in less than an hour; 45 minutes is pushing it. Fran's is a great place to go if you actually want to enjoy the presence of your guest, maybe even get lost in a conversation or two.   The food was unsurprisingly as good as it sounded on the menu. The bacon-wrapped tater tots came out in an artful display: an ice-cream cone-shaped wire holder bore a salad assortment with three skewers that held the tots (see pics). They were unlike anything I had ever tasted before--themselves alone worth the trip. The meatloaf and mashed potatoes that came with them were also very tasty, and more than I could eat. The highlight of my meal, however, was the mac and cheese. I don't know how Fran's does it, or even how to describe it, but it was probably one of richest mac and cheese dishes I have ever had.  Our server was fantastic. I don't think I have ever had a waiter that stayed on top of my water level as meticulously and unobtrusively as ours did. Nice job, Fran.   Whether you're dining with a book club, planning a girls night out or just a date night with your spouse, Fran's is the perfect place for every occasion. Thank you, Fran, for a great meal and a one-of-a-kind dining experience! PS- you need a website!

nVfKFvH4BELCelgbPemHKA.text: We went last night for dinner, and it was half off wine bottles.  Great plus!  Also had the great big salad plus chicken which was delicious.  The dressings are yummy and made in house.  It was pretty slow, so we got great service.  My boyfriend had the meatballs and loved them.  Will definitely go back!

cyIKSymmsmCEEjsuughtPA.text: A delicious Charlotte staple. There are always creative seasonal specials, and their salads and burgers are consistently delicious.

fH87YQ0vNDc3oYhkQ2XsTQ.text: Had No. 3 sandwich on sourdough with side of quinoa - extremely mediocre.   Friend got fried pickles which were actually some of the best fried pickles I've ever had, not overly greasy and there was a hidden flavor that I couldn't put my finger on.   Server was hard to hear, awkward, and slow to check us out.  Nothing about Fran's blew me away enough to warrant my return.

bdpJz4HgKSMIAszdggmuag.text: We love Fran's! We have visited 4 or 5 times the last couple of months. The food is delicious- I always get a different salad for lunch. Tonight I had dinner there for the first time and got the fig, goat cheese, and Brie flatbread. It was amazing!! My boyfriend always gets the burger, which comes with the yummiest fries.  The service is great! Our waters are always full and the servers are pleasant and not pushy. I also really enjoy the ambiance. From the paint color, the lighting, and the flowers outside- it's just very relaxing and pleasant.  If you haven't tried Fran's, you need to give it a shot! It's a great place to add to the mix.

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fig, Brie, and goat cheese flatbread. Delicious
Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burger and fries! Amazing

hX-Wp_MMGP9tPsQQv5MrDw.text: Super good food. Get the fig and goat cheese flatbread. Great wait staff as well. Been here 3 times and always have top notch service.

_-Tal6pApcsB-DaW7Cj3Ag.text: The Bacon wrapped tater tot sampler was great.  Lots of bacon and sugary stuff on sticks...nicely done.    For dinner, we got some burger that was on a pretzel roll, and it was enjoyable. Maybe it was a little bit too greasy, but it's a burger, so I cannot really say much there.  The fries were maybe a little bit under fried, but they were ok.  Fran's was a little bit of a weird place for me.  It was good, but some reason it left us a little flat.  It's kind of like a 1st or 2nd guy off the bench....solid role player, hustles and plays D, but you are not looking to play this guy in any meaningful crunch time minutes.

sgvFNMMQy7LE-YVGuYByng.text: Went here with my husband a few days ago and was severely disappointed. After reading all the positive yelp reviews I was excited to go here. Upon arriving we were told by Fran that our table had been given away because we were "late". When we made our reservation we were not told about any late policy but said we would be there in 15 and they said ok. So to hear that they had just given our table away "45 seconds ago" really passed me off. Why ask for a cell phone number if you aren't going to call before giving our table away?  Fran came off very abrasive and I was ready to walk out.  I could write about the terrible wait staff and how the waitress only took my husband's drink order and walked away without even letting me order. But I'll get to the food...  The food. After waiting an hour and a half for our food to come out...and it sitting in the window for 15 mins before being brought to us... Nothing to write home about. We had the bacon covered tater tots and corn nuggets for appetizers. Overpriced... we got 9 tater tots and 10 corn nuggets for $8 a piece. Our burgers were cooked completely different...His was medium rare and mine was well done. The waitress did not ask how we wanted them cooked. The fries, boasted to be the "Best in Charlotte" were anything but. My fries were limp and not fully cooked while my husband's were over cooked.  The seating was very cramped and the decor was lacking. Fran came by our table and was very condescending when asking if everything was ok. Our waitress didn't tell us the specials or even ask if we wanted dessert. Just brought us the check. Thank god she did.  $55 for burgers and 2 appetizers?  We will never be coming here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Corn nuggets
Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Overcooked burger

M0hIhTAq2zGh-ONaedd67A.text: There was good, then bad, then good then bad so I landed at 3 stars for good old Franny.  The Good?  The bacon-wrapped sweet potato tots.  I sucked those things up like a hoover---they were so good and I was SO hungry.  They took awhile to come out so I was ready grub.  The Veggie burger on a pretzel roll was very good.  The tomato chutney and feta on top made it very tasty.  I ordered a side of brussel sprouts and they were okay...not necessarily chopped or cut or cooked the way I like but they were decent.  The Bad?  They apparently had some computer issues that night and we were there for nearly an hour and a half before our food came out.  Ridiculous.  We ordered burgers!  The waitress checked on us a few times but it still was so annoying.  Fran eventually came out and let us know what happened and that everything would be out soon.  She offered to buy us both a beer for waiting, which truthfully was the least that she could do.  She was nice but not very warm.  My husband enjoyed his burger but it was small.  The fries that are the "best in Charlotte" were some of the worst I have had personally.  Maybe they were in a rush because we already waited an hour so they didn't cook them all the way through?  They were fresh cut which I appreciate but they were limp and smelled like the skin of a potato which just grossed me out.  You know that skin/dirt smell you get when peeling a potato?  Yeah, that smell.  The prices were high for what we ordered.  I just wasn't that impressed. I guess I wasn't sure what to expect...it is somewhat of a diner/cafe/nice restaurant.  It definitely wins the award for being most unique...I'm just not convinced that is a good thing.

HD28m3VQvbd-D_KC55fm6A.text: I went during restaurant week and the staff and food were amazing. I brought my 2 year old daughter and they took care of her like she was their own. I would highly recommend going there for family night or date night. All out great

l-s2jtLSB-CxScAEkJFF9Q.text: Great place for lunch or dinner. Sandwiches are a great value, and delicious. Made with fresh ingredients and great variety. Always a good solid choice.

Sdh4XEF5a7E0CSJVg4cPSg.text: Food average, menu lacking and very subpar wine list.  The worst part was the terrible service.

KJz1_9zwL3nBkRv34HZ1WQ.text: This place is a little tricky to find especially since there is two side by side strip malls so even with my GPS I pulled in the wrong one. The sign is small and hard to read as you drive by so be watchful or you will miss it!!!  Some of the reviews I had said service was bad or it was unclean. I experienced neither I will say it was pouring rain so it wasn't super crowded that night.  My waitress was very friendly and helpful.  The place was very clean as far as I could tell except the bathroom was kinda run down and needed some fixing!  We started with maple bacon wrapped tater tots.  The bacon was perfectly cooked and crispy, and the maple glaze added sweetness to balance the salty. They were sooo good I will say a little pricey I think 10 bucks for 9?   I ordered the California style burger with havarti cheese and avocados (amazing combination).  I have no idea what bread they used but it was a great burger I hope to go back and try more of the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon wrapped tater tots with a maple glaze!

JtDEiM_09pUQaTpDjfYlsg.text: Came here for a friend's birthday party.  We were seated at a long table in the back.  I ordered an appetizer to share with the table:  the fries with blue cheese and fines herbs.  They definitely needed a good salting, even with the sprinkles of blue cheese.  For my entree, I got the eggplant Parmesan.  I appreciate that it was just plenty of eggplant and sauce.  No pasta to wade through.  However, it didn't stand out to me.  I had forgotten what I had eaten by the time I wrote this review.   Service was a little slow, but we had a big table.  That is understandable.   I am glad that I gave Fran's a try and will come by again.

iHO6QlKIC4k95rVQ56YmZQ.text: We tried Fran's out for the 1st time & it was excellent. Eva was our server, she's very friendly & attentive. We enjoyed having her as our server. The food was incredible, from the heirloom tomato salad to the meatballs and the lemon cake for dessert. People at our table also had the crab cakes & chicken paillard. We all had to taste each other's food & it was all delicious. We'll definitely be back. The atmosphere, service & food were all excellent.

f96Uy2pKKcJYKS0Ajqn8hw.text: Our dinner for three was great. We ordered small tapas to share and was not disappointed in any of them. Bacon wrapped tater tots, mussels, frites, calamari, and fig and goat cheese flatbread. All tasty and served at the right temperature. The calamari was served crispy on top of marinara. I like this since I love plenty of marinara and you couple scoop out the sauce with the food. The frites were garlic and parmesan.  Nice and crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. The bacon wrapped tater tots had a slight spicy kick to them, yum. And the flatbread was a nice flavor with the fig jam on the bottom topped with the melted cheese.. These 5 apps and a bottle of wine ($35) were ~$75,  a very reasonable price. The waitress was knowledgeable and attentive. And they served a free piece of cake for our birthday companion. We went on a Monday night, here were a few other tables filled with guests, but not a busy night. It was a great experience and I will definitely go again.

8M7jOHfHkwVyNQeqIK8KSA.text: I've been to Fran's a couple of times.   It's the kind of place you want to love but they seem to just miss the mark.   Both times the mixed drinks were not very good - one I sent back.   Go for a standard and skip the creative.    The food can be very good or very boring.   On my recent visit, they were out of salmon - at 6:30 on a Friday night???  When salmon is not only an option for every salad but also the main fish entree?   Fran's is a local hangout so I suppose if you live nearby you enjoy seeing people you know but it has a cold decor.    The back room feels like a conference room.   The first time the service was great.   The second visit it was passable.

36EiG_mEEBtFTbuCsM-e_Q.text: Food was good. Service was awful. We never heard about the daily specials, our waiter never asked about drink refills, our waiter never came to our table except to take the order & give us the bill. However, We observed the other waiters taking care of their customers.

GrDXydezrJbsHp9ddG6wBg.text: DEAD ROACH IN MY SALAD. That I found halfway through. Will not be returning.  It's a shame because I think overall the food is good. I had actually been here the week prior and ordered the same salad, Arugula Berry with Grilled Chicken, and it was amazing - so good I had to come back. I have to say this time around, aside from the dead bug, the salad was missing the blueberries and the chicken was pretty dry compared to last time. My mom, who ordered a sandwich, had to change out the bread because it felt and tasted stale (her chicken was great though, as were her fries). I'm normally not a picky diner, and hate to complain having worked in restaurants before, but this entire experience was just off. The bug sealed the deal, and I won't be returning.

fvaxBWg13xF1LbYogQqyUg.text: First time experience... ~ They were able to accommodate a no reservation table for 2 on a Saturday @ 7:30p. Restaurant was busy inside and out.  ~ Service was excellent. Staff was attentive and we did not wait at anytime throughout our service.  ~ We had the Brussel Spouts for a Shared App.; New Southern Chicken Sandwich; House dinner special: Chicken Paillard; Bread pudding; 2 glasses of Wine and 2 pints of beer....   Price might seem a little bit steep at first glance, but you get what you pay for... All of our meal was crave-able and will will be back... soon!

_7kNfWEs9MTrG4HgEOIUAg.text: We love coming to this place.  The staff are great and the food is always good.  We often go for lunch but it's really the dinner specials that are outstanding.  There is always something new and interesting at dinner on the specials board.  We came recently for a birthday and felt terrible because we were the only table in the restaurant (it was only 9 pm but winter weather kept people away).  We knew we were keeping the staff late by being there but you wouldn't know it.  Everyone was very nice and service (and the food) were both great.  This is a great neighborhood restaurant.  Fran has created the perfect casual atmosphere with excellent comfort food.

Rn-S1HamKkyLeKbU1W7GeQ.text: First time visit. Saturday afternoon for lunch, busy but not crowded. Started with the fried pickles- good but they were too salty for my taste. Generous portions for regular lunch menu- fried chicken sandwich was with goat cheese and pepper jelly was great! Lunch special tacos were good, but did not come with a side. Overall good experience and look forward to returning to try other menu items.

Qzl6hLBKWsW4v-9ognRTIw.text: Terrible. Definitely gone downhill since they first opened. Has lunch there today, about 11:30am. No one was there to greet us when we walked in, and even when the server saw us he didn't come right over, finished stocking napkins or something and then eventually came over to us. We were only one of two tables at the time and yet the service(mainly the time to get the food) was very very slow. Server didn't know menu items. My tuna for the tuna tacos was very rare, server didn't even asked how I wanted it cooked. Both my tuna tacos and my mother's beef tacos had zero flavor. None. The server never once asked how things were, if we needed anything, etc, and even seemed to actively ignore us. Again, it was not busy-Two servers and only four tables, so not busy. I can only hope it was his first day on his own. $28 for undercooked, bland food and poor service. Will probably not go again, DEFINITELY not what it used to be.

Ndvc1UxiSu96jXmVzeyrjQ.text: I ordered the sloppy burger with potato salad for my side and it was great. I also recommend the bacon-wrapped tater tots, fried pickles, Picnic deviled eggs, and the Tex mex chicken spring rolls.

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sloppy burger and potato salad

zMaiCvlrSPw078Oulqbacg.text: Love this restaurant. Joe and Eva go above and beyond with great service. This restaurant is tried and True. It's always so good. The lamb burger and kale salad are the best in Charlotte! Not to mention the meatballs are beyond yummy.  Highly recommended!

OaJ1vq2MHiL45fjai-uwjQ.text: Fran herself was fabulous. Dinner was great-the flash fried Brussel sprouts were awesome. My partner loved the Latin Wedge salad. We had a long wait for food but Fran took care of us.

uhYKEjR1WGY3si9whWJ25g.text: This a great date night spot. The service was good. The menu offered a variety of options for everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. The red snapper with butter sauce, jasmine rice and bok choy was tasty and not over filling.
Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. These mussels were everything. Restaurant week!

eN65HHhZ7XKH8oSptYTzBw.text: Four years later and I am still a fan of Fran's although until recently it's been over a year since I've been there.    Fran's has been renovated a bit since my visit last year.  It's been painted a gray/blue color, they built a bar in the back outside of the kitchen pickup window and there are a few pub tables there. The have a new room for groups off to the side apparently taking over part of the space next door.  With the bar addition, they added a beer cooler and additional taps which feature all local breweries.  Foodwise, Fran's still rocks. The menu has changed a bit but there are still the standards like meatballs and bacon wrapped tater tots.  On my two recent visits here, I had the fish tacos which were excellent. The fish changes depending on what is available. I've also had the panzanella salad which was amazing with beets, sweet potato, shaved brussels sprouts.  Other people I was dining with had the lamb burger which they raved about, and flatbread pizzas.  So if you haven't been to Fran's in a while, definitely come back and check them out! Very happy to have them in my neighborhood. And with the recent bar addition, I have a local place to just chill and have a beer.

kHF6UoxkNQOoIO4l6iFnmA.text: I've been a long time patron of Fran's and have never been disappointed. Every time I go for lunch it's been ridiculously good. It's difficult for me to give 5 stars to any restaurant, but Fran's dedication to great food and unique taste definitely deserves it. Sandwiches are the mainstay of the lunch menu and you really can't wrong with any of them. I HIGHLY recommend the bacon wrapped tater tots. I have yet to try them out for dinner, but I will soon enough. Service can be a tad bit slow at times, but it's a rather small restaurant with a small staff that takes pride in their work. Once you understand that, the little bit of a wait won't bother you. Fran's will be your new go-to spot for a nice, reasonably priced lunch with friends and family.

mxEY9ymBJPXMeArbm-CdpA.text: Fran's Filling Station, what a hidden gem. Fran's has been on my bookmarks for a while so when I saw my new Meetup Group was going I was so excited and said 'Yes', count me in. I arrived and joined Jeff, another Meetup member at the bar. Watermelon margaritas were the special cocktail so I chose to go with that, and it did not disappoint. I did enjoy a second, ha ha! After the rest of our group arrived, we were seated at our table, which had been prepped prior to our arrival and was in the middle of the restaurant, overlooking the bar and store front windows. Of our group, we ordered a variety of items, burgers, pizzas and veggie sides, which everyone loved! I chose the pesto chicken pizza, which was cooked to perfection. The crust is more like a thick flatbread, crunchy crust with a perfectly cooked center. There was a great amount of chicken and the pesto was great!  I definitely look forward to getting back soon, to not only check out the bacon wrapped tots, but the brussel sprouts, they looked amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Pesto Pizza
Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Watermelon Margarita !

GiE5hT_nswXZciuIHt4pCg.text: We made reservations for 10pm knowing they closed at 11pm. When we arrived, we were the only ones in the restaurant so service was very swift & our waitress was lovely. Both my boyfriend & I ordered a special; he got a ravioli and I got a burger...both were great.   My only complaint is that if a business says they're open until 11pm, they should remain open until 11pm. By 10:30, candles were blown out, flowers were taken off the tables and the computer monitors were being turned off. From the time we walked in the door it felt like we were there too late to eat. Staff was leaving, things were being cleaned and it was only 10pm on a Friday night. It sounds as though another reviewer showed up for dinner and found the doors locked, I would not be surprised if the lock was turned as we walked out tonight half an hour before closing.   I only make this a point because the mission of this restaurant seems to be one that really wants deliver on atmosphere and the late night visitor doesn't get it...perhaps this restaurant should consider closing early if it doesn't want late business.   Otherwise, food was great & staff seemed friendly. The decor was chic, it seemed clean would make for a great date night.   Best advice? Arrive early & check out the specials!

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States

MTmaptHtQAgXZErGEOJxPQ.text: I thought this place was great! We enjoyed the fried green tomatoes, sloppy burger, new south chicken sandwich, fries, deviled eggs, and wonderful service for a lunch. I would love to go back.

xNwbc5tbA8qSsgXdZJMNWg.text: I have to say the food here is great! Our waitress a blonde with short hair and glasses was not so great. I went to a lunch with my team here and we had a really bad experience. The waitress was pushy, cut us off when we were ordering and was flat out rude! We needed to ask her for some straws and she avoided us! Having great food is one thing but just because you have great food doesn't mean you don't need good customer service. I won't be back for a while, hopefully they will change this.

gJwy41GCka-1Hg8pNKufKA.text: Great burger! Neat place for meat eaters and vegans! A lot of choice for each.  I had the sloppy burger w/ fries, excellent meal fries were perfect staff was perfect. Sweet tea was horrid. Seriously, fix that, it changes the meal entirely.  Great seasoning on the fries and cooked perfectly.

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sloppy burger with fries

7rKIkSk-tv6Jyexibqguog.text: We really like small eclectic little places. We found this in little strip mall. So I was surprised that it had really unique food. We got there kind a late in the afternoon so the wait staff was not exactly happy to see us. They close after lunchtime but I we got there about half an hour before they closed. But they had an obvious attitude. I would certainly like to go back to this little place but the staff certainly need schooled on how to treat paying customers. All in all, the food was fantastic though.

49o-1QqUecNQUZfLmL1ZPA.text: Service wasn't the best but the food was fantastic. I will definitely be going back. I had the fried green tomatoes and the chop chop salad. Super fresh ingredients and both were served at perfect  temperatures. Excited to go back. Maybe a couple of more vegetarian options next time...

c4i3-nxTEIOQ8CVpomWPuA.text: Suddenly I remember why my husband and I stopped coming here 6 years ago.  (Actually, it wasn't suddenly, it was about 90 minutes ago when we were first approached by our server...who did not introduce himself, but led with "have you decided what you'd like to drink?" A glass of water would've been a nice accompaniment to your entrance.)  Anyway...   $11 for vodka + water ($2 upcharge for "rocks", oh! that must have been the crushed ice...)   $13 for an Old Fashioned - ALSO SERVED WITH CRUSHED ICE ... (maybe the jokes on me, and this is the new thing?)  I've had better tasting desserts from a sub-par grocery store bakery. (Which I happen to despise exactly because they taste like they've come from a sub-par grocery store bakery.)  Trust me when I say it's not about the prices - it's  that Charlotte has so many phenomenal options (that I'll gladly pay for), and then catching a glimpse of the ironic chalkboard message behind the bar while I sip on my underwhelming cocktail wondering what my server's name is...

rKwM-ClvMt6S-RoBpg5VNg.text: We had the salmon and mussels. Yum and yum!! Salmon was delicious and the farro was amazing! Mussels could use a little lemon but were delicious. The owner was super nice she can out and comped our mojitos and replaced them with wine to make sure we were satisfied. Great ambiance. Definitely coming back to this place.

vLxYjwQ8HbN5gci-s6yGBg.text: Frans Filling Station is a delicious farm to table restaurant. I love their fresh scallops, their delicious corn and grits and any fish special they have.  Their tomato salads are to die for. Perfect place for a more subdued dinner. I brought my dad here for Father's Day.

WBMAkSrbEhlHbh4_QmVIsQ.text: Visited with out of town guests,we wanted to share some local cuisine.  My husband and I shared a caesar salad and the wonderful meatballs.  Our guests chose a stacked eggplant dish and a chopped salad.  Our server was attentive and gracious and our food was well prepared and delicious.  Great service, creative menu and comfortable atmosphere.  I highly recommend Fran's.

NkvsRC_dC6KSdC_vvY_M2Q.text: Burger...the best. Atmosphere- quite and perfect. Did lunch on a Thursday. Service was fantastic...not too much but just enough interface with us. It's a awesome little joint that you should definitely try if you are in the area.

GNorvnJDDtQAmdxS9UtXtw.text: This place is great. I have been here twice and the food was great! I had the mussels and salmon tonight and is was amazing. Great service too!

27S4EvjhbICU6RSloK9TCw.text: This place is amazing.  Fran is awesome and you can tell how much thought and passion she has for the food she prepares.  A must try in Charlotte.

98l7L29nOpbdnWBy0nd-tg.text: This was my second trip here with my wife and I was hesitant because I remember our first trip being underwhelming and over priced. We tried it again and were severely disappointed. We had the calamari appetizer that was the smallest portion I have ever seen. I ordered the angel hair pasta entree and it was so over cooked the pasta had turned to a glue ball. On top of that the waiter was terrible. Never once asked how our food was or if we would like another drink. We will not be back.

tXcHlZ3YjEP_E-mbNC3ZWg.text: Chef and owner Fran Scibelli has created the kind of low-key neighborhood joint that feels like it's been there for years even though this Dilworth spot is still relatively new. Whether you're in the mood to indulge (hello, bacon-wrapped tater tots) or want simple, healthful fare, you'll find it in this casual sun-splashed dining room.  The pan-fried sweet corn nuggets offer a crispy exterior yielding to the moist crunch of the corn and pair perfectly with the cool goat cheese ranch dip.  Fran used to run the now-closed Metropolitan Bakery, and her skills with bread have only improved. If a dish includes bread, you can bet it's house made--and tasty.  Wednesday nights feature half-priced bottles of wine and include an appealing selection. The best time to go is Friday its South of the Border night. When it comes to satisfying a craving for pork carnitas and margaritas, Fran's rivals any Mexican spot in town.

RrnwPLvSWBC5ZW4_mhHPEw.text: So,  I've kinda been on this secret hunt for a good, down to earth, non chained,  restaurant in Charlotte that I could call my "go to place" since I moved here 2 years ago. (man that was a long sentence....)  I didn't have a specific food category I was searching in, I just wanted to stumble upon a place me and Hubs could frequent.    I think I might have just found it.  *cue music*  Hubs and I were invited to a work dinner with some of his  work peers and his boss wanted to go to Fran's.  I knew nothing of Fran's....never heard of it...and didn't even know where it was. His boss didn't even say anything like "oh this place is awesome" or "you're gonna love this place".  Just told us where to be and what time.   My expectations were LOW.  I just knew that  we had to go because it was for work.  We pulled into the parking lot and when I saw the establishment I was really glad my expectations were already set low.  I kinda sighed and thought "great...it's going to be like bar food with bar fries and saggy bar hot wings.  gag."  Boy was I pleasantly surprised.   Inside, it's like a totally different atmosphere.  I thought "hmmm this place is cute on the inside...."  It was basically just my table and about 3 other couples that were there.  It was a Tuesday night and it wasn't busy at all. It's small though. We had a table of 8.  We had several rounds of the appetizers that was ordered by Hubs' boss.  Even though everything that was ordered was all FRIED, I still wanted to try it.  There were these corn fried hush puppy things that I couldn't get enough off.  I can't remember what they were called but my lawd....it was good.  Then I tried these bacon wrapped tatter tots...what the?!  LOL!  Everything is better with bacon apparently.  YUM.  Then I caught a glimpse of fried pickles.  O.M.*chewing* I LOVE *mouth full of pickles* fried pickles.  I apparently looked like an addict shoving those in my mouth by the fork full.  I haven't had fried pickles in a long time and these were fresh, hot and crispy.  My mouth is watering just typing about them.  I then had the french fries which were ok.  I'm not a fries lover...but they were good. A bit soggy but good.   Now in a food carb coma (and a good one at that)  I had to order an entree.  The menu has  only been out for a week now.  And the waitress was extremely knowledgeable already.  I asked about the lighter food menu options and she was so helpful.  I had the muscles in white wine garlic sauce.  They were off the chain!!! (is that still a cool slang term?) wanted to jump in my bowl and bathe in all that garlicky wine sauce.  mmmmm.   The wine list was not huge HOWEVER they had some really really good wines on that list.  Local beers from Birdsong as well.  My hubs' boss told me the story of Fran's background and who Fran is.  It made my experience even that much better and I can def tell that she loves what she does all because of the food.  Prices were really not that bad.  Sure a burger on a giant pretzel roll will cost you $8 but it's worth it.  That's what Hubs got and it was delicious.  I will pay money for good food.  It's good quality food and the prices are not extremely high.  Wines were about $6-8 a glass and it was a GOOOOD wine.  mmmm... So as you can tell *wiping drool from face*  Fran's touched my food soul.....    I should be doing lunges while I'm typing this.  I'm sure I ate 2000 calories.  But it was worth it.

aWoDXQYq5lVHmPfYdOlh8w.text: Fran's is an absolute gem in Charlotte! Atmosphere is great, nice local craft beer selection, two different little bars (for those of us who like bars!)...The menu is very unique and the food is excellent!  From the Cheesy Meatballs, to Lamb Burger to Chicken Milanese and on--ton of flavor and great attention to detail.  The owner Fran always seems to be there and is very engaged in the menu selection, cooking and customer service.  Very unique restaurant. I have high expectations on all fronts and nothing disappoints at Frans!  Trust me...Head to Fran's.

JESaHvyMZRh5eBIFXlBP4g.text: Fran, your food is filling. So filling. And sooo delicious. Hubs and I dropped by for a casual dinner and pretty much ordered way too much. Big shocker, I know, but really we couldn't help ourselves. The menu was filled with comfort food goodness.   Inside, Fran's is really adorable. There are about 15 tables and a small bar right at the front. All the servers seem to work together to greet, seat and take care of their customers. I'm a big fan of teamwork.   Once we settled in at the bar, we started with the Fried Pickles and were happy to see a huge portion - one side was spiced, while the other was plain. The flavor was right on and the breading was nice; my only suggestion would be to crisp them up a bit more. For my meal, I ordered the Latin Wedge Salad which is filled with yumness - corn, roasted red peppers, iceberg, creamy sherry vinaigrette, avocado, boatload of cheese and grape tomatoes. The salad was one of the best I've had in Charlotte; it was super flavorful and ginormous.   And of course, I had to try the Mac 'n Cheese, just for research purposes. Holy yum. Again, a huge portion for $6. It's absolutely a meal and half on its own. Per Fran, who is just incredibly sweet and friendly, her 'mazing mac includes cheddar, American and pecorino cheese. The service in total was top notch - all the servers were knowledgeable, laid back and offered great suggestions for we first timers. Although, I was clearly super full, I ordered the Chocolate Cake, again, just to see how it was. (Yeah right)   Now, I'm a huge chocolate fan, but not always a cake fan because of the potential dry factor. I am delighted to say that the chocolate cake was fantastic - moist cake, delectable frosting (not too thick) and a huge scoop of whipped cream AND ice cream. You can say I made room for dessert and planned a long run for the next morning.   I left Fran's Filling station with a super full belly, a huge bag of leftovers and the notion that I certainly want to be a regular here!

eO_yOKMPAzqEkBZ_LeLGMA.text: Fran's has one of the most ambitious menus in Charlotte. Unfortunately, the execution of the menu is decent at best, extremely subpar at worst.  Yes, they have the famous bacon-wrapped tater tots... but by the time they arrived at our table the tots were cold and the maple glaze has solidified into a gooey mess. As a main, I had the meatballs, which had a good taste, but once again were not hot enough. My friend ordered a salad and opted to get the grilled shrimp. For $5 she got three shrimp, which isn't a bad deal, I guess. But it kicked the cost of the entire salad to $12, and it wasn't worth it at that price.  The service was OK. Our server was friendly, and while he didn't apologize for the slow service or cold food, one got the feeling that it wasn't his fault and the kitchen was having issues. And this was well after the place opened, when most places have all the issues figured out. I'm guessing that the chef is a control freak who insists on doing everything herself, even though food quality suffers for it.

Ze3KAheCcP9jMOsXdFZuew.text: The atmosphere was very relaxing.  The fish tacos were nicely seasoned, very tasty.  Waitresses were very professional and helpful.

PYNKcj4KpzHa8k-0OXI_GQ.text: Fran's.....what a prize. It is hard to find a restaurant that is sophisticated, but not pretentious. Fran's is both. Food is outstanding! Portions aren't tiny but not overwhelming, well the deserts are overwhelming. Nice variety of entrees. Ambiance is slick sophisticated yet neighborly. Prices are reasonable, very much so when you consider the menu. And Fran, she's all around, saying hello. It just makes you want to go back. And most important the food is wonderful. One word of warning, share the desert. Don't think of skipping it, but don't try to go it alone.

qPPu-P2LV9j-zksNyngfcw.text: I went here with a group on a Saturday night. I noticed that it had mixed reviews on yelp but I was invited by  friends so I tried to keep an open mind. The first clue that I had that this  meal was not going to be that good was the fact that at 7:30 pm on a weekend night, there were hardly any people in this restaurant. Other than our party, there were perhaps three other parties in the entire restaurant. Most restaurants in CLT are busy on Saturday nights at that hour.  Basically the actual food does not live up to the menu.  I had the Chicken Marsala, it was not good, very bland, green beans not cooked well, almost raw - I did like  the cauliflower/potato puree. Overall, I felt I was eating a meal prepared for a senior citizen at nursing home who is on a restricted diet. It was just that bland and I left half on the plate and did not get a to go box.  Others in our party had pasta, one was a special and it was sent back because the diner said it tasted like Chef Boyardee (her exact words), the other diner had linguine and hardly ate any of it.  We also ordered a side of mac and cheese which was basically penne shells with very little  cheese sauce  on top, very bland and definitely not the traditional M&C. Both pasta dishes lacked sufficient sauce and seasoning.  The only people who seemed to enjoy their meals were the ones who ordered flatbreads, burgers and the Bass. We got a side of Belgian Frites which were barely warm and nothing special.  Another had the brussels sprouts as a side which I tried and they were dry and had no flavor.  We had two appetizers, the deviled eggs and bacon wrapped tater tots. The tots were great, the eggs, bland, no seasoning and somewhat small. The bread pudding dessert was quite good and others liked the chocolate cake.  In general, it feels like the chef does not taste what she/he is putting out, just churning out dishes with out much regard to the quality and flavor of the food. I gave it two stars since some dishes were a hit and the tots were good, even though my meal was not.   With so many other restaurants to try in CLT, I can't see coming back here for dinner again. You only have one time to make a first impression and this place really missed the mark with me.

BqYjKXkVJUrWPB2aKyuy0A.text: Dinner during Restaurant Week was fantastic.  The service was great considering the growing crowds as the night wore on.  Bacon wrapped tater tots are a house specialty, and lived up to the hype.  The meatball dinner and pepperoni & meatball flatbread were delicious.  The meatballs were soft and and the sauce was light and slightly sweet.  Cakes for dessert were exceptional with the house made whipped cream.  I've been here for lunch in the past, but this was my first dinner and I'm looking forward to going again in the near future.

13K45-49ocAMeOzbYx8IbA.text: Hate to do this since I never made it to the food but the atmosphere totally turned me off... So much so that we didn't even stay to eat. Weird corner spot in a small strip mall. The restaurant smelled like rotting meat. The bathroom was old and falling apart. The outdoor seating area was unkept and tables and chairs were rusting. We sat ourselves (as prompted) and no one came to the table after several minutes. And the straw that broke the camel's back for me....A waitress was coughing loudly into her hand as she took someone's order. We got up and walked out. Sorry just couldn't do it.

Pb1UqOTf5mEparwZnmyJ-w.text: This is a routine lunch spot for me and several of my co-workers.  Great spot with interesting menu.  Give it a try.

unoPOK-9ufQHXJ1jQbs77g.text: I have been here countless time for the laid back atmosphere, close proximity  and interesting menu options.  I agree with some of the reviewers here about the service.  75% of my experience with the service has been great, and 25% mediocre to bad.  Would love to see the restaurant be more consistent.  That being said, my server yesterday was absolutely lovely.  I decided to review today because I just reheated the meatball dish I purchased from Frans yesterday.  BEST MEATBALLS IVE EVER HAD!  The marinarra sauce is unique - slightly lemony with garlic and lots of flavor.  Meatballs are cooked well and have just the right consistency.   Order & try for yourself.

xanYT7adn7wUYvOm7auo1w.text: Have to agree with Scarlett J. on the server issue.  There is a clear potential to be a great little Cafe, and clearly has the following of such.  Fran's has always been a hot spot for locals.    My main complaint:  The lunch menu is better than the dinner menu.    For us, the stars are the sandwiches that the magazine rave about.  The turkey is just wonderful!  They are absolutely fantastic but are nowhere to be seen in the dinner menu.  We did have salads and veggie burger which were very good.  I nearly gave 2 stars just from the disappointment but there is so much potential.  Easy parking, easy access, great lunch.  Lunch is easy 4-5 stars.  Overall needs some attention.

NDhPlVkrNdna4Pa8uYMRRA.text: Bacon wrapped tater tots drizzled in maple syrup is the bomb!  They used to have the the thanksgiving on a plate which was awesome.    I am not much of a burger fan but honestly the pretzel bun is to DIE for!!!  One good thing with Fran is if you get to know her, she will make anything happen!    Meatballs with EXTRA bread are a must!!!  you can get them gooey but I like just a little cheese myself!

fbkNFiFB_rLubRrFVl23CQ.text: Amazing food and service! I'm a super picky eater and had a hard time picking one thing to order bc it all looked so good! The homemade pasta with braised short ribs made me want to come back for sure!

AIf0gXTumeeZvKtpHQaoFA.text: Another YERRAA challenge, Fran's turned out to be pretty rad!   They've recently remodeled the interior and while the decor is a little confusing (a mix of southwestern color and old timey chotchkeys) the space is pretty comfy, if very open. Tables are painted with varying themes, cute. Service was great, as we had several waiters checking in on us from time to time in addition to our main gal. You gotta love a staff that works together to make sure everyone's happy.  The lunch menu was simple, and somewhat veg-friendly. The specialty sammiches looked awesome (Croque Monsieur, Thanksgiving Stack, other inventive plates), but there was no veg option. You do have the option of assembling your own - choose a bread, cheese, veggie, etc. Salads work the same way - a list of house special concoctions, or build your own. I opted for the soup and salad side of the day, both of which were good - french lentil salad with onions, maters, goat cheese garnish. Tomato bisque, while salty, was very flavorful. A little expensive at $5 for a mug of soup accompanied by captain's wafers, but the cheapness of the salad side offset that to end up at about $8 for my meal. Sammiches are in that same range, and come with chips or a choice from their tasty housemade salads and slaws.  They have a wider range of veg options at night (including the ubiquitous veggie burger), according to our waitress. I'll make a point of coming back, as the flavors and attention to detail at Fran's imply that someone's really thinking about flavor. Lots of potential! Yay!

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. French Lentil Salad and Tomato Bisque (daily specials)

rPJkxGQp71u5a16BlLEMDw.text: We ate here a few weeks ago and I meant to post a review afterward but never did so here it is! My wife and I had an evening appointment nearby and we found Fran's on Yelp and cross-checked on Urban Spoon. Looked worth a shot and it definitely was. The food (Chicken Milanese and Beef Tenderloin) was very good and the service was great! We spoke with the owner a bit before we left and she was very pleasant and seemed genuinely interested in our opinions and pleasing her guests. We'll definitely be back.

LCarTuOkCOZVr3Ek2ZWreg.text: In the visits since my first it has unfortunately been the same story: the food is delicious, the atmosphere is homey and inviting, but unless I sit at the bar my service is, well, crap.  Usually I get the same server that just disappears, but during my most recent visit we went from patiently allowing our server to assume we didn't have anywhere to be on a Saturday to figuring out she had just pushed us aside to cater to others, because after my empty water glass sat on the edge of the table (long enough I had to stop eating because I was so thirsty) my wallet did too, and after ten minutes I pulled my credit card out and set that on top, and still waited as she checked on every other table but ours. I honestly don't care if she thought she was going to get a crap tip after the way we were treated (which I wouldn't do), the last thing a table wants is to be completely abandoned, especially in such a small space where you know she can see you!  When she did make it over with the check, even though something told me to look over it, in my rush I just handed her my card. Luckily, she had only charged us an extra dollar for the fries as making it to work on time was more important than getting the dollar taken off.   I'm sure I'll be back (damn you, bacon wrapped tater tots!), but I'm only sitting at the bar.

W2VGFwDldQSeNBXSVp158Q.text: We sat at the bar and the hostess wrapped silverware through our entire meal next to us at the bar. The sound of the silverware clanking around in the metal container was atrocious to listen to while dining. Food was good but won't be back.

SSAu7Pzi7kCdK1LQ1ii0QA.text: Fran's participated in the Charlotte Wine and Tapas event with 2 tapas and 2 glasses of wine for $30. Pro tip get the bacon wrapped tater tot duo. 2 different types of tots! The carletto Pinot Grigio was very smooth and delicious, and the chocolate peanut butter cake had a popcorn topping! Eva took great care of us all night. Highly recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chocolate peanut butter cake.

YbBa6vgLhTz7CgoNL8h_yg.text: I hadn't been here before despite it being around for the past 9 years. I ate the meatballs and they were so tasty!

xwCj_ankTT5ugJns4CsJhQ.text: Visiting from Georgia and saw this on the instagram must eat list in Charlotte. I was a little leery at first but must say it was a pleasant surprise. We had the bacon wrapped tots, the fried chicken sandwich and the lamb burger (everyone can't make lamb burgers but Fran's can). Keep in mind that the dinner menu is way different from lunch. The food combination are good. I really enjoyed it. I didn't give it five stars because it has a weird smell when you walk in, like gas or something.  Anyhow the food and service was good.

JXoElAknhkFXqf1l9VgWMg.text: Wow what a great spot!  Had family in town and we had an amazing dinner.  We started with The buratta and arugula salad and it was great.  You have to get the meatballs - they were unbelievable - so was the chicken piccata!  Loved how the owner walked around, meeting everyone and checking in their experience.  Plus our server Todd was so much fun! This place is a wonderful little secret!

iCBs0J_WvtHn9F9j5YYhHA.text: Met my son for lunch. We each had a salad and although it was correctly stated on the menu we were disappointed as it was sooo small.  Service slow and non attentive.  We won't return

UoHBvy2evq8pEMbFNereDg.text: In one word... horrible. First off, who in the WORLD places brown wrapping paper over their tables which already had white table mats?!?!? First strike for me was that... then, it came time to order and we were told that a good 4 items from the menu were not available or "no longer served" at this establishment. Strike two was the fact that not a single time, not once, did the server come by to provide water refills or check on us...and strike three was when it took well over 18 minutes -no lie- to bring the lamb burger which I ordered immediately upon arriving. Seriously? This place is a joke... I highly recommend against dining or having lunch here... don't waste your money, or better yet, your time, to have such an unpleasant experience. For me, it's never again...

-46KKsTUsyt08iG2NsRJMA.text: Delicious food and friendly staff. I had the stuffed chicken breast. My wife had the meatballs that were great too. The bacon wrap tater tots were delicious. We'll definitely go back.

yHBg9GOcrKOfXEnLefDpFg.text: One of my favorite spots in town. Great food and service. The fried chicken sandwich is a must have! The home made chips are the perfect starter for any lunch.

Oly1UOLgNchP0P7RQ5rVVw.text: Fran's was a bit pricier than I was expecting, but the food was nothing short of amazing. We arrived for lunch on a Wednesday and were greeted with a quaint atmosphere and great service (although the chairs were pretty uncomfortable). I ordered the Latin Wedge Salad and it was delightful. Very fresh and delicious. I also ordered a glass of wine and the pour was very generous. I will definitely be back to try again!

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Latin Wedge Salad

Va8VBryQMSlNItIWFRDKEQ.text: Got there about 7:00 with 4 girlfriends. Found out an hour after ordering that there was a 20 top in the other room and apologies that it was taking so long to get our meal.  This was a Tuesday evening so nobody really wanted to eat at 9:00 pm.  Anyway, I had a veggie burger with 1/2 kale and 1/2 fries.  Veggie burger was tasteless and the fries were little bits of burned leftovers that were probably sitting at the bottom of the fryer.  All in all a very unsatisfactory meal.  And Fran the owner was there most of the time we were sitting and did not bother to look our way once.  This was my second visit and last.  And oh...the health score was up a point from last time to a 93.  That should have been my first clue to leave.

M2tysaOilN7CGwJf-iq7Ww.text: They may have been having an off day, but we had a disgusting experience at Fran's.    Despite there being plenty of tables open in the dining room at 11:40 for lunch, we were sat at a table set up in a dark, noisy, back storage area in front of the kitchen. The table was not cleaned as there was dried food bits and such on the table.  It took over 40 minutes after we placed our order to get our food.    We ordered the rosemary black pepper glazed tater tot appetizer and got tater tots wrapped in the most bland bacon covered in pure honey.  There was no rosemary, no pepper, not even a smokey flavor to the bacon.  The honey made it taste even worse. The flavors didn't go well together, at all.  We thought they may have messed up the order, but the description of the other tater tots on the menu was nothing like this either.  Don't know what we were served, but it was not on the menu or enjoyable.  I've never had tasteless bacon like that before, either, by the way.   My #12 pastrami reuben was pretty bad.  The pastrami itself was awful with so much tough gristle that when I took a bite, part of the meat sprung back into the sandwich.  Parts were not able to be chewed because of the tough gristle.  Not a pleasant experience, at all.  My friend's #1 hot turkey bacon Swiss sandwich was not hot and the cheese was not even close to starting to be melted, as the menu description states.  The turkey was cold, not room temp or warm.  Not an enjoyable sandwich.  We doubt it was even heated.  The fries over both of our sandwiches were only partially cooked- like sponges that were limp, shiny, and oozing oil.  They were dumped sloppily over and covering the sandwiches.  You had to dig through the fries to be able to pick up the sandwiches.    Neither of our meals or appetizer should have been served, both from a quality and presentation perspective.   Throughout the bad meal, we had a front row seat to a cook who was having a breakdown, cussing, and hollering at the restaurant staff, belittling them and playing ridiculous games with them that only delayed things being prepared and getting to customers. It was like watching an abusive, alcoholic parent movie on the Lifetime network. Very weird and disturbing. I hope that guy is able to get help.  It's scary that there are people out there like this.  Our experience at Fran's Filling Station was like being in the twilight zone with really bad food that should have never been served.

sKEWF_kfjcYQP6e5STDvXA.text: Went for the first time today to Frans for the basic chicken sandwich special. 10 dollars for a fried chicken sandwich with fries and a draft beer! So good and such a great deal. They do this every Monday. The fried chicken sandwich was juicy and was served on a pretzel bun which is my favorite type of bun. The fried were crispy and well salted. We will absolutely be coming back!

QLcYusuwIvEaFKfAIzaN2w.text: I was looking forward to trying something new. I told the owner we had never been there. Got a quick, "Oh good." She didn't seem interested.   DON'T order the fig goat cheese flatbread. It's not a small plate. It's hard to eat...messy. Not a date appetizer. And it's huge. Did not care for it. Way too much fig and cheese, etc.   Brussel sprouts were awesome!  Not a good outdoor patio.  Won't return.

VBIQYHKTTt2nnjuBjGDpoA.text: I heard very good things about Fran's but unfortunately it did not live up to my expectations. I came here for dinner, upon entering the space inside is very cozy and has a nice ambiance to it. We ordered the fried tomatoes to start off with, oh my god this maybe a personal preference  but the goat cheese was SO strong, and the jam that came on the fried tomatoes was super sweet and strong that it overpowered everything. Originally I wanted a veggie order but partway though, the waitress had came out and informed me that the patty broke midway and it was the last one. Which was totally fine and understandable, So I settled on the crab cake instead! Let me just save you the trouble and order the crab cake! It was supper duper yummy, and big enough for 2 to share! We also ordered a flatbread, croque madame it was good as well. My cousin did say that her part of her chicken burger was partly burnt. Overall our experience here wasn't so great but if I had to recommend a dish it would be the crab cake! GET IT!! (:

HKFnSjOxR9hmuJfXUy7jEg.text: I looked for someplace close to work with outdoor seating on this beautiful February day. I moved from upstate NY last summer so still pinching myself that I can sit outside in February and enjoy a meal. Yesterday was my birthday so I'm still treating myself like I'm a Queen until March 1 :) There was plenty of outdoor seating and everyone very friendly. The menu is so good I had a hard time deciding what to order. I decided on #10 - the lemon chicken salad with french fries as a side (because who eats a side salad in their birthday month??). I meant to order it on sourdough but didn't specify so it came out on the wheat bread. Good mistake. The bread was incredible..tasted homemade and just beyond good!! Best chicken salad sandwich I've ever had. The lemon aioli spread on the bread added a great flavor. I enjoyed every bite & will be back to try many more menu items. Plus my server's name was also Katie :)

WaBCls6Vu3CfqcHFwMXc9w.text: Fun spot for restaurant week! Cute atmosphere once you get inside. Waffled cornbread and ribboned kale salad as apps, lamb burger and veggie burger for entrees- fries were top notch, then finished up with chocolate cake and cobbler. Peach and blueberry is what's in season right now. All enjoyable. More than we usually spend on a meal... It was all good, but not sure we'd return with the price tags on the normal menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chocolate cake with fresh fruit, caramel and whipped cream.
Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seasonal cobbler made with peach and blueberry.
Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb burger with french fries.

ZHyr0gTDb3JKPD_0NbcdsQ.text: Had reservations at 7:45 pm. Table was ready upon arrival. Waitress Katie was amazing, very attentive, friendly, and helpful with decision making. It was my book club outing, party of 7. No one had any complaints and generally a tough group to please altogether. Food came very fast. Seated perfectly for a large party. Food was very flavorful and great. I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab cakes awesomeness
Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Snapper deelish
Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chocolate Cake

pXaA9f8LSnWWqmBVKiMvJA.text: My fellow Yelpers did not let me down on the bacon wrapped tots. The sweet potato bacon wrapped tater tots were amazing! They were hot, the bacon was thick and delicious with a spicy sweet glaze. Next time I may try to other flavor of the tots. I also had the lamb burger. The burger was well seasoned and had flavor. The pretzel bun was everything. It was soft and delicious. I paired my lamb burger with the kale side salad and fries. Both were good and the vinegarette on the kale salad was light and refreshing. The shaved Brussel sprout app was also good.
