lkzjwYGBZruW5-auF5V0wA.text: So here's the thing about my husband - he's a casual guy. He'll dress up if I ask him to, but instead I look for place to eat that claims good food in a casual atmosphere. As you may have noticed on this page, Fran's claims to be a casual place for casual attire. Therefore, I made a reservation for two. When we arrived we walked into a front room where we were to be seated. But to the host's dismay, apparently my husband was too casual to sit there with his all black jacket, sneakers and baseball hat. He immediately brought one server up to get her opinion then the owner came over to deal with us. She nicely said, "We have a table in here but we have a back room too that you might like. It is more cozy and has TVs."   TVs? Really?  He wears a baseball cap so you assume we're some monosyllabic couple that would rather spend a night out watching TV?   I was so shocked I just blurted out "ok, let's go to the back room". There's where I saw other casually dressed people hidden from the front windows of the restaurant. They were jammed into tiny areas (we got seated so close to another couple that I could almost hear their hearts' beat). The tables were high tops and sticky. We were pressed against the beer cooler with chalkboard paint reading "Beer is proof that God exists".   My husband orders a water and I order a gin and tonic. We look at the menu and the first handful of main courses are hamburgers - all super overpriced.   Not interested in the food choices and getting more insulted by the second after it sunk in that we were fine enough to pay the prices that everyone pays but not fine enough to sit in their front room with linen tablecloths; we decided to leave. I paid my 13 dollars for one gin and tonic and we were off.   When I don't even feel welcome enough to want to eat your food then you failed. Enjoy the one star.

htIpbEBK3aBqVp9Go_4YsQ.text: I either get takeout or eat at Fran's at least once a week and have never been disappointed.  The daily specials are always different but consistently well prepared, as are the other menu items.  The staff and Fran herself are knowledgable and laid back.  HIghly recommend this place.

fUMSov435K5U7JK2af45hw.text: Service was great and so was the food. Sophisticated menu at an affordable price is a much appreciated and rare find. Somehow, they managed to serve a well-done burger that was still juicy and flavorful.

az5VAxfvkpXbUNtg-afSGQ.text: My hubby and I tried out Fran's Filling Station based on a recommendation from Nicole W.  She told us this was the place to get some great dessert so I had to go right away.  For some reason I had never noticed Fran's Filling Station despite being in the area several times (I'm at the Run for Your Life store in the same shopping area all the time).  We stopped in for a nice little lunch.  The lunch menu wasn't huge and most of the choices seemed kind of fancy.  I ended up with a hot turkey sandwich with a side of potato salad.  The potato salad lacked flavor and I wouldn't get it again.  The sandwich was very tasty and I had plenty left over for a second meal later.  The hubby got the daily special which was some kind of italian sausage with peppers.  It was ok, but my meal was way better (and he agreed).  Our service was just ok.  Our waitress was friendly but not overly attentive.  Fran came to our table to see how we liked our lunch and she was really sweet.  As promised, the best part of Fran's was definitely the dessert.  We ordered the tuxedo cake and it was outstanding!  Layers of chocolate and white cake with a creamy filling between layers.  Hubby and I were clanking our forks together trying to get the next bite as quick as possible.  One thing that felt off about this place was the music.  We were sitting down for a relaxing lunch and the music playing was bumping stuff like Black Eyed Peas.  Just seemed strange for the crowd and the atmosphere.  Overall the lunch menu seemed a little high priced.  I want to come back to try dinner and I'll definitely be back again for dessert!

ljLdEft11GtkGFLNkJNOTQ.text: i walked in with my gf @ 9:15 on saturday night, ready to try this place out. i had heard some good things. there were 2 tables of people eating/drinking and one table finishing up. we saddle up to the bar, waited for a few minutes longer than we would have liked but nonetheless a waitress walked up to the bar only to NOT acknowledge us, grab four empty glass and casually waddle back to the servicing area. she then proceeded to do something other than even speak to us to let us know she would be back to take our order...im mean nothing, the height of rudeness. we waited for her to see us getting up and walked right out of that b!tch. i highly doubt i would ever go back unless someone i trust pleads with me to try it again. too bad to b/c we just moved onto their FN street. poor show frans, supremely poor show...booooooooooo!!! ::sticks tongue out like a little baby::

f4XymVz-fx0XSyb42K1xCQ.text: I went to Fran's Filling station on a Saturday for lunch.  I wanted to try it out because it had the best french fries in Charlotte,  or so says the Charlotte Observer.  I got there at 11:30 am which is when it opened and there was one other table seated.  My server seemed to pretty casual and laid back.  He asked if it was my first time there and I said yes, so he ran over the menu with me.  He also mentioned that they had a bloody mary bar, but I'm not much of a tomato juice fan so I skipped that.  He went back to check on the specials of the day, while I looked over the menu.  My server came back and went over the daily special which was a turkey sandwich with fried mozzarella sticks.  I ordered that with a side of fries.  While waiting for food a couple of other groups came in.  My food came out after a reasonable wait, even before the two top that had been seated before me.  I ordered a beer to go with my sandwich at that time.  The sandwich was pretty good sized and the amount of fries was ridiculous.  The bread was a nice crusty french bread and it was stuffed so that I could hardly get a bite of it, but I managed.  It was very tasty and very messy.  The fries were a deep dark brown color and almost looked like they were burnt, but they were not.  They were close to being perfect.  The insides were light and fluffy, but the outsides just weren't crisp enough for me, so I was a little disappointed there.  But overall the food was pretty good and reasonably priced, $9.50 for the sandwich plus $1 for the side of fries.  For $10.50 there was enough food there for two meals.  The beer I got was a little pricey, $6.95 for a pint, but it was also pretty good.  If I come back I'll probably skip the beer and just get a sandwich.  My server was very friendly and very laid back, but he did make sure I had what I needed.  If we could give 1/2 stars I would give Fran's 3.5, but I just can't round it up to 4 because of the fries.   So 3 stars it is because Fran's is definitely A-OK in my opinion though.

_z10_6OwKTD_sngNtcKKAw.text: Went in w a hankering for a great big salad and Bamm!  There is was on the menu - I thought ok, but will they be flex on the changes?  Yes!  They let me switch out onions for extra cheese (Brie chunks), creamy Italy dressing for the Ginger dressing,  I switched other things too but can't remember but wow whatta great salad - and what great people - I give this place a 10!

U2xne8HYRfJRYsVolpePHw.text: I love what they're doing here - a cozy environment with warm service and amazing, creative food offered at a True value.  You can get a great entree for the price of 2 coffees at Starbucks and it's delicious & beautifully presented. The other night I had a delicious spice-crusted salmon over a ragout of artichoke hearts, chickpeas & roasted tomatoes that was as good as any fish dish I've had in months.  My friend had a wild mushroom ravioli with marsala cream & truffle oil that was too die for!!  Fran checks on every table, showing her True passion for hospitality and concern for her guests.  Be patient if you go on a Friday night - that was the night recommended by Charlotte Magazine, so they are packed!!  The staff tries their best to make your experience wonderful and it will be unless you're in a hurry.  Otherwise, a weeknight is a better bet for the same amazing food without the wait.  But I recommend Fran's whenever you go.  So much care for so little money is rare these days.

bbHhCbDqW0ln9e56xSyejg.text: As an experienced business road warrior for the last 16 years, I've had my share of restaurant meals. I always prefer to try local spots rather than the chains. I read in the newspaper and the local magazine that Fran's Filling Station had the best French Fries in town. Today, I wasn't hungry enough for a full meal, but the best fries in Charlotte sounded about right, so I went to Fran's to give them a try. An experienced diner can easily spot the signs of a poorly run restaurant. When I arrived, Fran herself took my order, but she may not think as highly of her fries as others because she laughed when I just ordered the Bleu Cheese Fries for lunch (that was a sign #1). Then on my way to the restroom, I heard her tell on of the kitchen staff to go to the store to buy Bleu Cheese (sign #2). While I waited for my order, I overheard Fran yelling at a server to stop talking and go get the drink order for table 4 (sign #3). When the food arrived, it looked greasy (sign #4). It tasted greasy (sign #5). No discernable Bleu Cheese was present by sight or taste (sign #6). I ate a couple of them and left. Asking $5 for a plate of greasy potatoes, Fran owes her relatives who work at the local newspaper and magazine a big favor! Even though it is nearby my office, I'll never go back to Fran Filling Station.

YLRsrMDPNn0BijRerjmJkg.text: I honestly can't see what the fuss is all about.  I went for lunch (no burgers---booooo) and my sandwich was good.  It took forever so they gave us some free sweet potato fries.  Maybe they were meant for someone else that left to find food before they starved to death.  Thankfully my after lunch appointment was running late otherwise I would had to leave too.  Granted, they were busy and the staff did their best to keep up but for lunch, I walked away thinking...huh???  Maybe Fran had the flu

8uQfkkWUXM_Zo5sexHQwGw.text: I've been once for lunch and again another time for dinner. For lunch I had a really tasty roast beef sandwich with some great fries. We started dinner with sweet potato tater tots skewered with bacon glazed with maple syrup. It was as good as it sounds. It was so good that I don't remember what I had for dinner. I guess that ends this review.

ZqqmFOHH0kvWvnvNygmnIw.text: Bottom line...is that the food here is great...from casual to slightly upscale. Meatballs are a must try. Not a great place for a drink at the bar...because they had no bartender the night we were there. With a slight upgrade in service, this place would get a 5 star from me.

-CGeTId0tubSXWcByLARjg.text: You'd think after being open for over a year a restaurant would be able to handle a semi-busy night.    A few friends and I recently went to Fran's to see what the fuss was about.  Not even mentioning the food, which was decent...minus the mussels that made my stomach turn, the level of disrespect and unprofessional behavior displayed by the manager (which I can only assume was Fran) was palpable and disturbing.  On a trip to the bathroom, I overheard the manager screaming profanities at her kitchen and waitstaff.  It was an incredibly hostile dining experience that I will never go back to.  She even yelled at a teenage bus boy "what is wrong with you?!"  Running a business is stressful, I understand, and I worked my way through college serving tables.   However, to keep people coming back and wanting to PAY for a meal: 1. Don't curse out your entire staff while there are customers in the building 2. Hire an assistant manager - one who works well with others 3. Try to remember that the happiness of your customers is directly related to that of your staff.  The food took forever to come out and drinks were way over-priced but good luck to Fran's.  I hope others have had better experiences.

fFSasxDgSl2eIfB5gM4oLw.text: The Boyfriend and I tried Fran's for the first time at lunch today, after passing it many a time on our way to Ru San's or Sunset Grille.  We were cheerfully greeted when we came in, and told a table would be cleaned for us shortly.  It was pretty busy, which I took as a good sign.  A quartet of women at the table near the door were finishing up their lunch by splitting two slices of cake, chocolate and (carrot?), which looked pretty delish.  Our waitress was somewhat soft spoken, and didn't mention the specials to us until I asked.  Both of us ordered the #6, french dip-esque sammies.  I ordered the pickled slaw for the side; he ordered fries ($1 extra ).  Our food came out after not too long, but I was momentarily confused at the appearance of piles of fries on both platters.  I brought this to the attention of the waitress, who apologized and said that the kitchen had been mixing things up a lot today.  She started to take my plate away, but I said that it was okay.  She asked if I was sure, and I was, because I didn't want my sandwich to get cold while they replated it with the correct slaw.  It'd probably have been better service if she had just offered to get me some slaw on the side in addition to the wrong fries they sent out, but she didn't. *shrug*  Fries weren't served with ketchup; we had to ask for it, which was brought out in two small plastic single-serve cups. If you're a ketchup fiend (we aren't) you'd probably need to ask for extra.  The good: the sandwiches. OMG, yum. The beef was tender, juicy and flavorful.  The rolls were buttered and crisply toasted, and stood up under the weight of the fillings. The sweet peppers and jalapeno slaw (Boyfriend got it without, but I like the spicy) in the sammie added nice crunch and zing to almost every bite.  The au jus was positively dreamy - the best beef dippin' juice I've ever had.  The meh: the fries.  I'd mentioned to Boyfriend that they were voted best fries in Charlotte, but both of us couldn't figure out why, based on what we were served.  They seemed a bit overcooked, very dark, and were barely lukewarm and thus not very fresh-tasting.  Kind of flabby and floppy.  Some people like that in a fry, but we weren't so impressed.  No room to try the cake ourselves. Maybe another time.  We will definitely go back, because the sandwiches were major noms and I saw several other options I'm keen to try, but next time I think we'll skip the fries.  Hope I'll at least get to sample the pickled slaw.

3F2X-NLaXfwZ7bwNCHVWlA.text: I adore Fran's.  It's super-crowded sometimes, and service gets a little slow, but when they bring you that pot of beer, bacon and hot pepper soaked mussels, all is forgiven.  I've only been twice, but because they have a mix of smallish plates I've tried quite a few items.  Always coming back to the mussels, though, I have to admit.  Anyway -- the deviled egg of the day was a hit one time and a miss the second time.  But a cool concept anyway.  Seared tuna was tasty, as were roasted tomatoes and "shrimp two ways".  The wine list is good and the "redneck manhattan" is outstanding.

SOrurpQadTkNq3DZA94mxA.text: This is my favorite place to eat is Charlotte, and that's saying a lot. Fran is super-nice. The food is unique southern food with a twist, the wine is great, and the frans martini is crazy good. I plan on asking Fran to marry me one day.

HFQvy3ZNNxuq2NL68vBpCQ.text: great wine specials..... food spectacular fresh local and great. Fran is there everytime we've been there . Always a great escape

Hkt6s8t6QlmU6EZIsEJTrg.text: I was tempted to give Fran's 2 stars because the food was sorta good... but the uncomfortable atmosphere, slack service, and undrinkable margarita weighted my opinion more toward the 1 star rating.  When we got there, the front dining room was almost unbearably hot. We were not offered a reason by the hostess or our waiter but I overheard someone telling another guest that the power had been out earlier. Partially forgiveable but it seems like it would have cooled off at some point while we were there.  Our waiter seemed awkward and uncomfortable speaking with us. But we were tempted by a margarita special and ordered two along with our waters. Mistake number one (other than deciding to try this place). The margaritas were truly undrinkable. Our waiter finally returned (oddly enough with a glass of ice to refresh our almost untouched margaritas) and asked how the drinks were. He seemed startled when we told them how bad they were but made the excuse that he was a "crappy" bartender and that they water down their mix with simple syrup, yada yada yada. Instead of offering to have someone else make new drinks for us, he told us they would be "on the house" and then left us without even removing the offending drinks.  Another server brought our meals, which were fine. I had the "great big salad" with salmon added. Good mix of veggies, somewhat small but tasty piece of salmon, and completely un-flavorful dressing. My husband order the veggie nachos (southwest special night) which looked okay but probably should have been offered as an appetizer.  During our meal, we were visited maybe three times by a server offering water... at least one of those times after my husband's water had been empty for a LONG time (considering how hot it still was in the room, maybe it had evaporated). Our waiter seemed afraid of us now and only checked on us once. When he brought the check, he did apologize once again for being a "crappy" bartender though it seemed he was just a bad waiter overall (sorry, he was nice enough but probably should consider a job for which he is more well suited).

q-iweWZfaBZrjwrNlA60HA.text: Best.  Lunch.  Ever.  Started out with the tater tot sampler duo, which consists of bacon wrapped tater tots.  I could stop there and it would be awesome, but the regular tots are painted with a peppery rosemary maple glaze  and the sweet potato tots are glazed with a Tabasco honey.  I paired these with a southern tier ipa.  The hoppiness of the beer went great with the spiciness of the 2 glazes.  Next I had the no. 8, which is the hot pressed ham and swiss (I chose rye and dijon mustard).  Usually I go for a more complex and interesting sandwich at Frans because the are all extraordinarily delicious (e.g. no. 9 the real croque monsieur or no. 2 the thanksgiving every day), but today I felt like keeping it simple.  I have been to Frans at least half a dozen times and have never been disappointed.  I highly recommend grabbing a weekday lunch or taking your time and pairing some cold brews with the food on a Saturday.

w1Omr0OkgmajeA9iXpvqJQ.text: Finally got to check out Frans yesterday for lunch. Unfortunately I wasn't blown away like I had hoped.  I got basically the french dip sandwich with the pickled jalepeno slaw.  Not sure there was any jalepeno in it.  Thought the sandwish would have been much better if there would have been some cheese on it.  I was disappointed to find the sweet potato chips were actually bagged chips and pretty tasteless at that.   Must say not sure that I'd go back for something just fair.

VH1ZyZb23NLs6kryqip5qg.text: Fun food and great service.  We had two kinds of bacon wrapped tater tots and both were delicious. The fried corn fritters with the goat cheese ranch dipping sauce were great. The gooey meatballs were very good. The bread pudding was good but not exceptional. The waiter was very good and very nice. He even gave us some tips (at our request) as to what to see in Charlotte (not a lot). Don't miss this spot for casual, fun dining.

faQCbfGnCOanw0uZLTTjdg.text: Fran's is my go-to on a weekly basis. Everything is fresh and delicious, and I've yet to have a bad meal. If I were on death row and was granted a last meal, I'd get the marinated goat cheese and 10,000 loaves of their baguette. MMMMM its so good!  Also, for those complaining about prices, IMO it is worth it for the fresh ingredients and taste. If I wanted just a standard pub burger and fries I'd head over to the Liberty. I hope Fran's is open for the rest of my life because I can't imagine living without it.

dJBxD3tQGYq2-moKnSEX3w.text: Superb food.  This place is exactly what I was hoping for.  Tasty food, good service, casual atmosphere.  I'd call it an American version of a neighborhood bistro; somewhere you could easily go three times a week for a nice meal.  We had the corn nuggets (yummy!) and calamari (my husband said it was a bit greasy).  Eggplant parmesan and an artichoke chicken special.  The chicken came with roasted potatoes that were cut in a small dice and got nice and crispy.  Everything was very flavorful.  Desert was fantastic.  Delicious bread pudding and perfect chocolate cake.  I told my husband to just come here to pick up some slices for my birthday.  Note:  Portions are large.  I ate half my entree and had yummy leftovers for lunch the next day.

Dycvp3WZ04qWtp-EeDaivQ.text: I have to disagree...It has just received 3 stars from Helen Scwabb but i don't get why!   I literally just finished eating lunch there and it was a definite miss. The decor to the place was so Blah and the one out of three severs working was running around sweating while the other two did there checkout! Put that all aside its truly about the food right?   Well I had the soup of the day it was good a parsnip and corn Bisque i liked it then my Nicoise Salad with Tuna came....i want to be nice but i really had hoped the cooks would have maybe say cleaned the lettuce so that i wasn't chewing on dirt! It was all wrong in my mouth and all I could do was push it away and throw back my coke! The lettuce was dirty the Tuna wasn't seasoned and was overcooked. My boss was with me and unfortunately had a similar experience with his Meatloaf sandwich he asked for it Hot it came Cold and just not good! Our server was not attentive and didn't catch on that it wasn't good.I love trying new places but this one really surprised me after the review and what Y'all had to say about this place. Maybe it was an off day but it was by far a bad dining experience. I really found the menu to be all over the place too many different style's of cooking the concept needs to be more clear cause its not just south-or southwest cooking. To be honest I'm not too sure what they are going for but maybe they should do something different!!

VyVhn-fvcvHIlZOLJqqKcw.text: Best customer service I've experienced. The food was excellent, a must visit. The pretzel bun burgers can't be beat.

ZAJ23quUnQb-2ZFTH7l5eA.text: When Fran's first opened, this place was great!  Now, it is quite the opposite.  Service is abysmal, slow and not attentive. Here are my experiences on their takeout.  If they tell you it'll be ready in 20 minutes, they really mean 45.  This happened to me on three occassions.  Since I always had to wait at the bar to ge the food, you would think it would be piping hot..well no.  The fries are usually luke warm and the Rosemary Chicken is always cold in the middle.  And twice they have gotten my order incorrect, making me go back to correct. I stopped going to Fran's because of their  consistent inconsistencies.

ARoqNWPj8MFPIWotwe3KZw.text: I waited for an hour and 15 minutes today for lunch. We were told that our meal was going to be compted, but when the check arrived they only took off our drinks ($3.00).  However, the people next to us got their entire meal compted for their, lesser wait.  The last time I was there, I had hair in my food.  My wife and I are easy going people.  I can get over the hair and my glass rarely being filled.  But when the owner dosen't come out and apologize, and then treats other patrons better than me, then they have lost a customer.  It's a shame too, their Cali Burger is very good.

RhVtC4lSDu8YqGkS4gxzoA.text: love the tater tots with the maple drizzled over them.   Anything I have ever eaten at Fran's is delicious.  Great atmosphere.

JbqH_zFzlPvAQ1Gmr5WvJw.text: Forgive me Charlotte natives, but your folks need some food education. Why is this place getting so few four and five stars? The Charlotte magazine voted it in the top 25 restaurants in Charlotte, and I would place it in my top 2 or 3. I loved the menu -- it leans toward the southern and comfort food side of things, but certainly with innovative offerings and choices that made it difficult for me to choose. I took the suggestion of others and had the bacon wrapped tater tots in maple syrup coating -- OMG. They were sinfully delicious, and I ate every one of them. The homemade meatballs served in one of the best marinaras I've tasted in the US was really extraordinary, and I took home half of the portion for lunch the following day. Perhaps my perspective is skewed by NYC and LA, but I thought the prices were incredibly reasonable, especially for the service and the large portions. I loved the experience.

n3pmj_pYvkSkzuaAmtXRJQ.text: Literally amazing!!!!!! I will be a regular here no doubt. Best meal I have had in Charlotte in a while. Service is outstanding.

qkyJbhVdTDlQnsMOOJC3Vg.text: Sorry Fran's.... I was a long time supporter but we are giving up on Fran's. Ate dinner there last night 1/9/2019. Restaurant was not busy. Our shrimp scampi appetizer was over cooked. My boyfriend got the Risotto special, the portion was a little small. I got the new south chicken sandwich (which I usually order at lunch) with fries and for dinner you charged me $16 for it. The portion was no different than what you serve at lunch and at lunch it is $11. I'm sorry. You guys have lost a fan. That's just price gouging for no reason. With as many choices that we have in Charlotte for really great food and restaurants that don't play games with pricing .... we are moving on. It was good while it lasted and we enjoyed many of our meals in the past. Farewell old friend.

PJMXdvVipsZpVh92d8JKEQ.text: I've been here twice now and both times the food was fabulous!!! I think this makes for a great nicer lunch spot!   First meal I indulged in the buffalo chicken sandwich which was so worth all of the carbs and calories!! It was one of the best fried chicken sandwiches ever! And those fries were delicious as well. I had great service my first time as well.   Second meal was really great as well but I was disappointed with the soup that I got. This was a difference in my personal taste because my date loved it. Our service wasn't quite as good this time. It appeared that our server was busy doing his cleaning and side work duties instead of taking care of us.   Check this place out! I plan to revisit for a dinner before to long because the food is completely up my ally with the refined southern flare.

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States

R8gKlYC08TXNVcaZdN8jKA.text: Frans is quite a snobby eating place. I saw a waiter kind of take a glance at my husband and I when we were having a casual lunch stating yes we are more of a up scale restaurant( He was the original waiter who brought us water) It took forever to be waited on and they were not busy at all. Finally, a nice down to earth waiter approached us and did not judge us with our casual Sat attire. The food was not great and was disappointed as this was our second visit to Fran's. The first visit was about the same- we had our child with us. Again we did not feel welcomed. So if you are dressed up and want to pay more than what the food is priced and worth- Go to Fran's!

gUi3hxQkqORtp3IrqCo0vA.text: It wasn't my first trip to Fran's and it won't be my last. For what my wife and I were looking for, we had a close to perfect evening. We only wanted a light meal prior to going to the movies. We split the bacon-wrapped tots (maple bacon, not jalapeno bacon). I had the Chinese chicken salad and my wife had the scallop appetizer. Then we finished with a slice of key lime pie.  Our waiter, Todd, paced the meal perfectly. He suggested that since my wife liked lighter beers/ciders that she should try the strawberry lemonade beer they had. It was an excellent suggestion.   What I take away from Fran's in the times I've been there. I does food well and allows you to have a light meal or a full meal with superb choices for each. While the scallop app only comes with 2 pieces, it lays on a bed of Carolina Gold rice and a corn/bacon relish. Everything pairs well and it is an excellent small plate. The chinese chicken salad is dressed ideally for my taste, the chicken is tender and cooked perfectly.   When my wife said she was eyeing the key lime pie earlier in the meal, Todd put a piece aside because they were getting low and they brought it out without it actually being ordered. And I will admit, had we been with certain friends, this would've been made a huge issue and they would've ruined the evening complaining about the presumption. That's not the way I roll. When I go out to dinner, I want to have an enjoyable night and Todd made it enjoyable, and frankly, bringing a dessert we wanted is fine by me - it came off as a caring touch.   That's how I sum up Fran's. I feel comfortable there. I like the food. I like the atmosphere. That's why I'll keep coming back

YfTbv73o1ZqqLygX6Vx0FQ.text: Asian style calamari was amazing. Chicken sandwich and half & half (kale salad/fries) was....amazing. Great neighborhood spot with a friendly staff and relaxed vibe.

O3G8i-pzmD7FbG7gzW6NNQ.text: Had lunch here today. The food was good but rather pricey. We were encouraged by the menu, which was interesting & creative. We waited for 20 minutes for our drinks, a long time at lunch. The bacon wrapped tots were delicious but rather skimpy for $12. Beet salad hardly had any beets. The buffalo chicken sandwich was really good, nice soft pretzel bun... but it's spicy, which was great but the side of ranch was slow to come & they charged extra for it... kinda chincy for a $12 sandwich. They need to work on the service... friendly but slow.

8gsfz-sIpIYZhNYLwwMRtw.text: Ate dinner here last night on a last minute date with my wife. Rather than chance it, I made a reservation on Open Table for 7:00pm. I arrived before my wife did and saw that it was mostly empty and that it had a nice patio to enjoy the nice weather. So, I grabbed a book and headed for the door.   Upon being met at the door by the hostess, I was asked whether I had a reservation or not. I told her that I did and she went to look at the computer, which I could plainly see, too. There were only three reservations between 6:30 and 7:15 and, as I said earlier, the restaurant was mostly empty. She then told me that my reservation was for 7:00pm and wanted to know if my guest had arrived yet. I told her that she hadn't, but that I'd like to go ahead and grab a table until she arrived. She grabbed the menus and walked me outside. When she put them on the table, she just stacked everything (menus/specials/utensils) for me to unstack myself. She just seemed to be disgruntled about something, but I shrugged it off.  The waiter (named Todd) came by and he was great. He was personable and knowledgeable about the menu. His recommendations were great. I got the meatballs and orzo. Flavor was great, but the dish was a bit watery because they didn't drain the orzo properly. I'd still get it again, though. My wife got the crab cakes, which she loved because of the amount of crab in them.   Would recommend this place to my friends, but would tell them to ignore any unfriendliness they may encounter at the front door.

Y7i16Wiy0C1IXRtIbOJOBA.text: I loved my soup and sandwich combo. The pastrami Rueben was delicious. The broccoli soup so creamy and cheesy. I have had no issues with Fran's whenever i came here, that is until today. I went to pay for my meal in cash since I actually I had cash on me today. I'm waiting and waiting to be checked out and the waitress finally comes up to me to advise that they had no cash in the restaurant. What?!! Seriously what type of restaurant has no cash? Thankfully I had my bank card and I paid with that. But what if a customer had no bank card on them. You know it could happen. I truly can't wrap my head around this!! No cash, really Fran?! I just don't know about this, it seems suspicious to me. Maybe I was singled out. I mean I can't believe a restaurant would have no cash.

TClyY6OWAvEzWBOJglmblg.text: Off night at Fran's  Went Out with friends to celebrate a birthday after bragging on Fran's Filling Station.   I'm embarrassed and sorry I suggested eating there.  Horrible service last night, Friday, August 3, 2018 and food was not good.   The special appetizer, artichoke and crab dip, had no artichokes and I'm not sure any crab was there. Just a hot cheese dip. Not good  The $25.00 steak looked like it had been boiled; gray in color - not seared with no taste,  HORRIBLE, disgraceful   The chicken special of the night was not special and was floating in sauce.  Half of the food was left on the plate it was so bad. Then the waiter was offended and expressed it when we did not want to take the rest home  The salmon was a small, thin, dried out piece of fish.   The senior servers reminded me of used car dealers over selling the food. Their description of the dishes were not what was delivered to the table. Trying to get a second drink or a refill was a challenge. The only time the server was nice was at the end of the meal when the check was brought to the table, and he made a last ditch effort to get a bigger tip.   This experience was so bad  I will not be going back, and I am definitely going to contact the friends I recommend this place to and tell them to stay away,    Very disappointed

9uA47Gsg95IHbbWr2ACz2Q.text: Love this place. Great ambiance and food. The owner is often there and you can tell she cares about the food and customer experience. Breakfast pizza is amazing.

XvKmuyTpo0Czubspk-xexg.text: Fran, the owner, was extremely rude at the end of our dinner. I have never experienced anything like this out of all the restaurants I have ever been to. We finished our meal, signed our checks, and less than a minute later, she walks up to our table and says, "I hate to be inhospitable, but I need your table for people that are waiting." Who in their right mind would ever do that to customers who just spent almost $200 on dinner for only 3 people. I told her she was extremely rude and how would you ever tell a customer, who had a reservation and just finished their meal, that they need to leave when they just signed there checks. She says, I'm sorry you feel that way, but I need the table. Definitely do not recommend this place and will never be back here.

-ridCh1lAh3GPf1FqKp1WA.text: The owner is the RUDEST person on face of the earth. I was treated poorly. It is my belief that the color of my and my party's skin has a lot to do with it. Stay away. Diversity is not respected here!

YWx1IRF0vxS4GjVttg48Hg.text: It started well!   Cesar Salad - Delicious and crisp!   Fish Taco's - My friend said it was good fish, but the taco part was off.   Special - Penne pasta with Tomato cream sauce. It was not the best, not the worst. The amount of sauce made it worse than it really was.   Desert - Berry crisp - TERRIBLE : First it came cold, then it was hot, but the topping wasn't even cooked all the way through so we're talking raw dough that stretched right off my spoon.   Bottle of wine - my friend ordered for half off Tuesday.   This was my first and last experience coming here, even though it's convenient!!  **  Our waitor seemed to be completely off.  Frank, practically forgot about re filling my water. He didn't check to see how the food was at any course. Frank spent a great deal of time with one couple telling stories, talking and not paying any attention to other guests. The lady who seated us was kind enough to come over a few times even though it clearly wasn't her job. When I asked Frank to describe certain dishes he left out ingredients. For example the berry crisp he left out cherries. And in the pasta dish he didn't mention there was cilantro. Luckily I don't have an aversion or allergy to those, but they should be described properly to make an informed decision.

NFTVY5wxROR1AtnyB5t3bQ.text: Last night my boyfriend and I tried out Fran's for restaurant week. Well, we originally decided on a different restaurant, but last minute I had a hunch I needed to switch restaurants. So we picked Fran's since we have never been there before. The menu looked great and it looked like an awesome deal for Restaurant Week. I was really happy that all options on their restaurant week menu were on their regular menu.   We had an 8:15 reservation but were able to seat us when we got there at 8:00. Score! We got a romantic table by the window, which was great. Our waitress was super friendly, but while she said she was not in a rush that night, she definitely talked fast and took our orders quickly. But she was attentive with making sure we had enough water and everything was okay. And when then was an issue with the bill being incorrect, she was super apologetic and took care of it quickly.  We started off our meal with two delicious cocktails: the blackberry mojito and peach mule. Both were incredibly tasty. Not sure they were worth the amount they charged, but they were large enough that they lasted the entire meal...at least mine did!  For the appetizer we split the fig, brie, and goat cheese flatbread. That might have been my favorite thing we ate. It was HUGE and so incredibly cheesy. The sweetness from the fig puree was just perfect. After my boyfriend at his half of it, he said he was afraid to drink his cocktail because he wanted the taste to linger more in his mouth. Well done Fran's!  For our entrees we split the Skirt Steak and the Crab Cakes. Both were excellent. The skirt steak was cooked perfectly (medium-rare), but the portion was small compared to the fries. The fries were soooooo delicious. They were perfectly cooked and seasoned. I could have had a whole meal with those fries! The crab cakes were the perfect mix of crab and filler. They were incredible. I even liked the slaw on it...and I typically hate slaw.  I had chocolate cake for dessert and my boyfriend had the warm bread pudding. He almost licked the plates after we were done eating. I wasn't impressed with the chocolate cake. It was fairly bland and the whipped cream frosting was underwhelming. I wouldn't get that again.  Overall, it was an amazing experience. I want to go back and try a bunch of their other starters. I highly recommend!

Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tons of fries with a little side of skirt steak

PMKhp81WwYEDoUEvddIv_g.text: This is a response to Janee we eat at frans all the time the food is always excellent service is top notch I think if you are so picky just eat at home then you can only bitch at yourself find another hobby

45sbDXI3BaZEzhpw4ufKtw.text: Had this at an event. The quinoa with chicken was filling and delicious.

D1UrE4aVKO5PbP5MoXs0bg.text: I support owners of local businesses especially when they are passionate about it.  Fran's does that for me.  While dining on the outdoor patio, there's Fran talking to her patrons and keeping everyone on point.  I like that.  I ordered the shredded brussel sprout appetizer and Fran's Meatball entree on a bed of orzo.  Very good.  The portions were plentiful, too, so they packed up my leftovers to carry home (others did, too, which I consider a good thing).  My server, Tamara did a great job; morever, several other servers were quick to talk, refill my water, etc whenever they saw the need.  Well trained, indeed.  The highlight had to be dessert, which I rarely order.  Key lime cake seemed innocent enough (unless you're my dietician), but holy moly, this piece stood on the plate like the rock of Gibraltar.  It was freakin' huge . . . and awesome, and huge, and awesome.  A True OMG slice of heaven daring me to dig in.  I did!  And I'm coming back for more!

6vxoQRPsYt5fwf-mI0PQPQ.text: Very disappointed with this restaurant and will probably never return because They allow no substitutions to their menu. You would think a customer service driven business would make accommodations to allow for a side change. My daughter wanted to sub couscous for a salad. We were flatly told no subs and that you can only drop an item and not replace it. What a poor way to operate a business and now this place has lost a loyal customer.

1U06Gbfy8iUq-hj_Ko6SAg.text: This place is consistently great. It's casual enough that I don't need to get dressed up, yet nice enough to take my mom here for a good meal when she's in town.   My mom and I reach got a salad and we shared a bottle of wine and a flatbread- we had so much food! The salads are awesome with extremely fresh ingredients and the perfect amount of dressing. I'm pretty sure the salmon on my mom's salad was the most perfectly prepared piece of salmon I've ever seen. My Latin wedge salad with chicken was to die for and the chicken was flavorful and juicy. We had the fig, brie and goat cheese flat bread which wasn't much to look at but had awesome flavor. I do wish it was actual figs instead of fig jam but it was still very good and I would order again.   The prices are a little higher than I'm used to but everything we had was fresh, well prepared and very high quality. I will definitely be returning to Fran's (my mom is already asking when we can go back!)

Fv_7kHOz42_Uib0cwjxBLA.text: So, Fran's has amazing food and I love the quirky atmosphere of the place. My only complaint is that, considering it was slow when we went last Friday, the service was pretty sluggish and, considering the portion sizes, the meal was a bit pricey. We'll definitely go back, but we'll have to budget ahead of time. We both had the bison enchiladas and were completely in love with every bite!

GtN7Ww_fbHkC-l1NruM-ug.text: First experience. Got take out here recently. Both of us got the meatballs (2 meatballs & toast per order), and the tater tot sampler - $28.35.  Pros: Tots are wrapped in bacon -yummy. Meatballs were also yummy. Cons: A bit pricey for the meal, but it was good. T hey were out of one of the desserts from the menu that we really wanted to try (lemon something???).  We'll probably be back, but not ready to recommend yet.

dz_b-ERS2-l5fbA9Mtqbpg.text: Plusses - Plenty of parking: Fran's is located in the same strip mall with Run for your Life and Fiamma, which means there's parking galore. - Attentive waitstaff: Fran herself came over to chat with us and brought crayons for the 2 year old at our table - Ecclectic homey food: bacon wrapped tator tots?  Fried sweet corn with goat cheese ranch dressing?  Meatballs with gooey melted cheese?  Don't mind if I do. - Generous portion size: I like to eat, as does everyone I was with, and we were stuffed after our meal.   - Price: reasonable, especially considering portion size.  The seafood options are a bit more expensive, but that's to be expected.  Minusses - Odd table layout: the front room holds ~10 tables and bar seating, but as you head to the bathroom in the back, there are tables along the hallway and oddly placed near the kitchen pickup window - Menu confusion: Reading the menu, I just want to exclaim "what IS this place?"  Deviled eggs, nicoise salad, eggplant parmesan, buffalo fried chicken sandwich, and mussels (three ways: traditional, curry/coconut, or beer/bacon) all co-habitate on the menu.  On one hand, that might mean everyone can find something they like.  On the other hand, it's just weird.  What does Fran's want to be when it grows up?   - Food quality & flavors: it's not bad, but it's not amazing either.  The macaroni & cheese side was bland, the lamb ragu was not as good as it had been talked up to be, the chicken milanese was just so-so.  However, the goat cheese was incredible; the goat cheese ranch dressing is a wonderful little cup of surprise (dunk all the way to the bottom, and you'll be rewarded with chunks of soft goat cheese.  You're welcome) and the goat cheese salad that came with the chicken milanese was my favorite of the whole meal.  Moral of the story: if it has goat cheese, GET IT.

Xu_oLm6TYXMwqIycXldGBQ.text: I am giving Fran's 3-stars.  It might deserve a little less, and I want to give it more.  I have been twice for dinner and had the meatloaf which was kind of mushy, and the slow-roasted beef which was pretty good.  My wife had the entree order of Mac and cheese--let me just say that I don't get that but the wife thinks it is genius--and she enjoyed it, but thought al dente pasta was odd in this dish.  The next time she tried the meatballs which she liked.  On our first trip we started the the fried-pickles which were really good.  I haven't had the guts to try the Bacon-Wrapped Tater Tots with maple, black pepper & rosemary glaze but one day I will because...well, just because.  I suppose that I have tipped my hand that I will be going back again.  I am determined to like this place.  A waiter told me that the desserts are wonderful and that their chef was really a pastry chef.  Maybe that explains the execution on the food--accurately measured ingredients but not enough heart and soul.  Perhaps I should go right from the tater tots to dessert?

jo5nMZ1Yk7baLCFAGuveBA.text: After reading Rha W's review I almost didn't try Fran's for fear that the place might attract patrons like this.     But my wife and i did go, and we are glad we did.  We thought Fran very much hit the mark of her stated goal: she identified a void and filled it well.    The tater tots were fantastic, and each of us enjoyed our straightforward but tasty entrees.  The service was attentive, and Fran herself checked on us a couple of times.  Good energy to the dinner crowd on a Saturday evening, at least in the main room.  Seemed like a bunch of locals who were quite comfortable in their own skin.  A nice change of pace from much of the SouthPark restaurant scene.

Xxq7YC-wYUZmBQ6txGDSDA.text: Fran's is what you want a local restaurant to be.  It's a small location with a very comfortable feel.  It's casual but not lazy.  The staff and owner are ultra friendly and work really hard.  There is nothing fancy about the decor, tables, chairs but it works.  You want to join in.  Let's get to what matters . . . the food.  I love their food.  It is an interesting blend of simple, comfort food and yet there's a touch of upscale too.  Everything tastes amazing and makes you want more which is a problem because the helpings are generous so I usually leave reconsidering my diet that I keep putting off.  I should give a shout out to one of their appetizers, the bacon wrapped tater tot.  That's right, you read that correctly, tots wrapped in bacon on a skewer.  No more needs to be said.  If I'm trying to find a negative it might be those wanting what Fran's is not.  The bar is pretty simple with a limited wine selection.  My wife loves their flavored martinis and they offer some fun beer so there are choices.  This is not a place to go for a crazy Friday night nor is it a five star restaurant.  I'm glad it's not.  It's not trying to be all things to all people.  It has stayed True to itself.  This is the restaurant Charlotte needs.  It's not a chain and it's not over priced.  This is a great place for friends to gather and enjoy wonderful evening of food, conversation and fun.

Gm8hiXreb7Pg9aE1Lm4yfw.text: I am not sure why we waited so long to try this place out.  This is our new favorite spot in the South Charlotte area.  Everything I have had from here has been excellent and I love that Fran herself makes many of the dishes and often times comes out to greet us.  We did a rather large order and carted it all the way to Taylorsville, NC(about an hours drive) for Mother's Day this year.  I highly recommend this little spot, the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich is to die for and the sweet potato bacon wrapped tater tots aren't too shabby either!

Vzn_5yqACDOEBpyQ5Yxkeg.text: Pros: Great comfort food with a wide variety of dishes.  Great service and good atmosphere.  Family friendly.  Owner greeted all tables and was very welcoming.  Cons: Beers are pricey and beer limited selection.  Small dining space.  No reservations accepted.  Favorite dishes: meatballs, roasted beef, eggplant parm, tater tot appetizer   Went with a group of 9 on a Friday night at 7:30pm (prime time) - the hostess was very accommodating and worked hard to get us seated together with a reasonable wait time for 9 people.

L7-DZZVCi823kb2yx8HBBA.text: We eat at Fran's at least once a week, but usually more. Her food is heavenly from the decadent to the healthy, you can't go wrong. Her sandwiches (homemade bread) are so good, especially he number 1 & 6 but I would be 50 lbs heavier if I ate those every time, so I stick to mostly salads. The great big with chicken and Latin wedge are my favorites, the dressings are delicious. For dinner, I usually go with a special but my  friend lives for the meatballs or milanese every time, craves them actually. Homemade goodness in every bite, Fran's food is simply divine!

_GvxdMk8QaYKixxBg4XDfQ.text: I ate here with some friends and really enjoyed it.  The food was rich and they had a good wine selection.  The staff was friendly and welcoming.  We ordered several apps and shared.  The portion size was really good for apps.  I'll go back and try dinner next time.

ZQ03hoHkJSmXTXJJxptGTw.text: I like Fran's I think it's a little pricey for lunch & the service is definitely a hit or miss., but they changed up the lunch menu a bit and the make your own salads section is the bomb.  I'm always looking for a good salad place for lunch and Fran's is now at the top of my list.

kWDEEbVP_FdUPSHe3OQccA.text: I was really disappointed in the service my mother received at Fran's Filling Station.  It was the first time in six years my mother has visited Charlotte. She had been driving all day and she just wanted something small to munch on.  She was seated and inquired about an item on a kids menu ( I get it's for kids and she's a grown woman) However instead of saying our policy for kids menu is 12 and under or even suggesting something else that would be around the same portion size or price they rudely suggested you sit and think about what else she would like.  She got up and left and felt very insulted.   I've worked in the restaurant industry for over 5 years and I've been approached with the same request a time or two, sometimes you got to let things slide or politely explain how your company operates. (Most of the time people understand)  I have enjoyed Fran's food myself.........I'm just very disappointed that the first place my mother goes in Charlotte was disrespectful towards her.

YQzJWIkByT63_8vZpvfVAw.text: I've had two good experiences at Fran's and two not-so-good experiences. Unfortunately, it is the latter that has prompted this review.   My co-worker and I arrived for an early lunch and received bad, unapologetically slow service in a virtually empty dining room. Our server didn't smile once, mumbled at each interaction and messed up my order.  I'm sorry, is my business annoying you? I do have to say, the food is usually pretty good. Alas, not in the case of today's veggie burger which crumbled to flavorless pieces after the first bite.

Z7-CzbyMW6w-SAPhEonW8w.text: Fran's where the food is great and you feel important. It was our first time here and I'm a picky person. Fran and her staff went above and beyond to make sure our meal and experience were fantastic. The food is fantastic. This is a can't miss place and a fun ambiance.

aenlfB6A8h4-xEVy1QN3zw.text: Had a delightful experience with the owner of Fran's Filling Station on Park Road, NOT. It was around 10:30am and there was no parking at J Majors so I parked in the next shopping center's parking lot...which was practically empty being that all three restaurants were not open. I start walking down the road and the old hag starts screaming at me and threatening me from her car.  She then started screaming at another couple getting out their car before she even knew where they were going.  It blows my mind how rude and unprofessional she was, all from the comfort of her car.  I will never again support this restaurant and recommend you all do the same.

W1RQgC4HW6CEgFPjks29cg.text: I love Fran's Filling Station! My mom and I decided to eat here because we loved the Metropolitan Bakery and Cafe. When we went into the restaurant we were greeted by friendly servers and observed happy customers. We couldn't wait to try the "Best Fries in Charlotte" -boy were they fabulous!  Everyone knows Fran's for the incredible lunch sandwhiches but you have to try the dinner menu. My favorite entree is the meatballs. The bacon-wrapped tator tots were delicious and unlike anything I'd ever eaten before.  I give Fran's FIVE STARS because not only is Fran's menu is creative and unique but there is something for everyone on the menu. Come with your family, come with your friends, but you've gotta try Fran's!

B5emuk_0-6jqpSxgVg78Hg.text: I have never NOT left a tip, until tonight.   Two friends and I went to Fran's after reading some reviews and we were very sorry we did. We were seated quickly and offered menus and drinks but that's about the last time we received any service without having to ask for it.   Fran, the owner, finally took our order since we didn't seem to have a server. After waiting about an hour and asking three times for the status of our order (and trying to decide if they even had it anywhere), we were frustrated and ready to leave. We made the mistake of staying.   While we were eating and the other two tables were finishing dessert, Fran came out and let both of those tables know that dessert was on the house because of the slow service. She told them this loud enough for us to hear. We were shocked at the unprofessionalism of the owner. We had been there longer and received much worse service and at this point, had done very little complaining - even after I had to go to the bar myself to get a water refill.   We have all been to restaurants before that are busy but this was unacceptable. It's not about the situation, it's about how it's handled and this situation was ignored, just like we were.   I've had two firsts tonight - the first time I paid my bill but didn't leave a tip and the first time I've even reviewed a restaurant negatively.

UA3p7gFeXaI6BveyOpAiYg.text: Best Mac 'n Cheese in Charlotte.  Everything we ate exceeded our expectations and the service was great.  The meatball dinner entree is a must try.

Kg5AmM2e3uAMKmNTNub2-Q.text: Fantastic food!!! So good that even as you get too full you just can't stop eating.

ooC0peoXh0ZCCVGAfGhjyw.text: I love Fran's Filling station. Unlike in Europe, the USD goes far at Fran's. The menu has good variety, but isn't overwhelming. It can get crowded on the weekends, so make a reservation and prepare to wait. I've never had to wait for a weekend lunch or weeknight dinner. With its eclectic menu and reasonable prices, it's a great spot for many occasions.   The staff is always friendly, but also seem to never know what's going on/ appear overwhelmed. Once I ordered a manhattan and the bartender used dry vermouth. I noticed later that it's on their martini list. I've had orders arrive without sides or with incorrect sides (I just deal with it, but I'm sure they would fix if asked) and a couple of items on my receipt didn't match the menu prices (again, it was $.50, odd, but I was ready to go).   I try not to eat out if I'm in a rush, so it doesn't bother me. Some of my less patient friends and family members get pretty annoyed at Fran's. I don't care as long as they're nice and the food is tasty.

CFQCcwrIHnAGaIJliHPZ3g.text: I really enjoy the ambiance and decor of Fran's.    The food is good, but it is a more upscale price point.  It's a convenient neighborhood location and I enjoy meeting friends there for drinks.

_ccHHLbbh0sK6I7RVyGlNA.text: Just had one of the most amazing meals I've had all year at Fran's.  Can't believe I haven't been to this amazing, little restaurant all these years I've been in Charlotte! Guess it might have something to do with it being wedged between 2 of my fave restaurants in town (Fiamma and RuSan's)...but WOW, guess better late than never?  We started with one of its specialty apps, Bacon-Wrapped Tater Tots, over a bed of lettuce...and they were simply to die for!! Then our entrees were just as Amazing!! My husband had the California Burger, and I think he left thinking it was possibly the best damn burger he's ever had. I ordered Fran's Meatballs, which came with a HUGE portion of cheesy Orzo, even a slice of bread. O-M-G!  So...as for the food, beyond good. Amazing!!! However, sadly, the entire dining experience could have been better.  The restaurant itself was a bit stiff in decor. It's a nice place, in a black-n-white motif, classic, old fashioned style, but it felt somewhat stark and uncomfortable. I did, however, enjoy the overhead music they played...which seemed to range somewhere between folksy to classic pop. I did notice afterwards that they had additional seating areas as you walk toward the back...so the place was much bigger than I had first thought.  The biggest downer was the extremely small table we were led to... initially thinking because we were just a party of 2. That is, when we requested a bigger table in the corner, the waitress made it clear that she was saving that table for a bigger party. Then, in hypocritical fashion, she seated another pair (another party of 2) several minutes afterwards. As it turned out, it was not even a full night, and we could have easily been seated at one of several bigger tables left empty...so that's where my aggravation lies. For that bit of UNcourteous service, I'm docking a star. BTW, our waitress did a fine job, so no problems there...but the table was just way too small, the chairs way too stiff...and overall, not comfortable in the least.  Again, the food was excellent and I would have loved to have given this place 5 stars, but thanks to the stingy seating situation (extremely small table...NOT comfortable), it ruined a 5-star dining experience. Still, for the food alone, we're bound to revisit in the future. If they are generous enough to seat us at a comfortable table next time, I may upgrade the review. :)

Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. California Burger (with Kale)
Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon-Wrapped Tater Tots

LW_mpeEm8aavcRxUT_e9-Q.text: Keep going back over and over and this restaurant continues to be one of my favorites in town.  I am even more enamored with it as I get to know Fran and her story and what she has done in her life.  Opening this restaurant was one of her accomplishments that we can all enjoy.  Here is my original review:   Never heard of this gem until a friend pointed out that it had been in the Charlotte Observer as one of the best places for soups and chowders.  On a cold wet day, it seemed like the perfect place to try.  My big question is HOW has this been here for over 8 years and I never knew about it.    I looked at the Yelp reviews prior to going and so many of them mentioned Fran sitting on a stool at the end of the bar.  Sure enough, when we walked in, I immediately noticed a lady at the end of the bar.  Our server confirmed that it was Fran.  I hoped and hoped that she would come to greet us during our visit. I noticed that she was talking with at least one table of customers.    I ordered a chicken salad and a cup of corn chowder and some unsweetened tea.  When the chicken arrived, I was surprised it wasn't in the salad that I expected. It was on a sandwich with lemon alioli.    I must have misread the menu.  Nonetheless it was delicious.  The corn chowder was even better.  It was thick with corn and potatoes.  The unsweetened tea did not taste unsweetened.   The waitress assured me that it was.  I didn't need sweetener in it.  Hm  We loved the atmosphere.  It was tasteful and chic.  The patrons appeared affluent and professional!  We were leaving and I was so disappointed that I hadn't met Fran. After all, she's put together a perfect little spot.   But wait, just as we were exiting, she turned around on her stool and said "thank you".   She redeemed herself and I left with a  great feeling about Fran's!  Two thumbs up. I will return.  Soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States

3vNXA9aO2g0R7C2Bg3-IPQ.text: So I rolled out to this spot to meet up with my Book Club homies. There were 6 of us. I arrived promptly at 610 PM and was immediately seated. Waiter came immediately after and asked for my drink order.   I don't wait for people before I start eating and perhaps that's rude but i gave my peoples a heads up cause a chick be hangry, you feel me?   So I'm sitting at the table kinda nodding to the Earth, Wind, and Fire tunes coming from a speaker in the corner. Interesting. Doesn't match the vibe but I can dig it.   The started with the Warm Artichoke and Crab Dip. Waiter told me, "I'm in for a treat." OKAAAY!!! Well I'm looking forward to it cause I ate once today.  I was able to try someone's Flatbread with Brie, figs, and something else. It was pretty good. Kinda on the sweet side but I liked the concept.  I tried my homie's bread and butter with garlic. That was good too.   My Warm Artichoke and Crab dip was delish. A little on the salty side but it was still pretty good.   I ordered the Special Short Ribs which came with green beans and dude said Cauliflower Mash, but it tasted more like potatoes. Either way it was all REALLY GOOD! The meat was so tender and juicy. It could have used a little more flavor, but with the accompanying sides, it was all soo tasty.   All the ladies enjoyed their food.   I'm only taking one star off cause while we weren't rushed, people were starting to pour in about an hour after we got there. So towards the end of dinner, we weren't offered any desserts. I really wanted to try the Apple Pie. I could have asked but it honestly felt like he or they were ready for us to leave to free up the table. Also, while the specials were written on the board, dude didn't let us know about them. No biggie. Maybe next time I'll get there a little early so as not to "feel" rushed.   All in all the service and food were great!

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Braised Short Ribs with mashed cauliflower and green beans
Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Warm Artichoke and Crab Dip

GWWOXDqds19b4M4at9KZxQ.text: Fran's is delish! I finally made it over to the restaurant after wanting to visit for a while and it didn't disappoint. I arrived right around opening time of the dinner shift and chatted with Fran for a sec as she was leaving. She is awesome.   I was seated immediately and started browsing through the menu. I saw bacon wrapped tots and immediately knew that was a must order. These were delish! I recommend getting the duo so you can try both types. For my entree, I ordered the Penne Al Forno upon the recommendation of my server, Phillip and it was amazing. The tomato cream sauce was perfect! I'm definitely looking forward to going back to try more items!

W0wR3IvbLj1P0etmbACVLA.text: My husband and I had a wonderful time at Fran's for my birthday dinner. We made reservations through Open Table for a Friday night at 6. When we arrived we were seated promptly in the front of the restaurant. It was a rainy night and only about half of the restaurant was full by 8 when we left.   We ordered the lobster dip for our app. It was served promptly with delicious grilled garlic bread. The wedge salad was big enough for two with a fantastic dressing. The cilantro and corn added a nice touch. My husband had the salmon with broccoli and rice. It had a sweet bourbon glaze that was delicious. The crab cakes were large (and mostly crab) and the slaw and sauce that came with them were lemony and perfect. The NY cheesecake was a perfect size with the best dulce de leche drizzle, fresh whipped cream, and fresh fruit. Hubs got the peanut butter cake. He said it was moist and he loved the fresh fruit on top as well. I had coffee and it was very strong but really good!  The ambiance was cozy and Phillip our server was kind, knowledgeable, and engaging.   Overall great experience. Phillip mentioned that on Mondays and Tuesdays in the Tap room you can bring kids and listed an extensive kid's menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. NY Cheesecake
Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Peanut Butter Cake

5VjQSOt6ad9tu6YtJ-q0Yw.text: We had to try our Frans for restaurant week.    We were seated immediately and our waiter was really excited to serve us and did a good job selling the menu.  We ordered a bottle of wine.  As a tip, wine bottles are half off on Mondays and Tuesday's!  You can't go wrong with the bacon wrapped tator tots.  I also ordered the eggplant appetizer which was incredible.    For entrees we got the scallops and meatballs.  The scallop dish was a little salty, but the scallops were cooked well.   The meatball entree was delicious.  Order these if you want something more filing!  The best part by far was dessert. The chocolate cake was ahhhhmazing!   The lemon Chiffon cake was incredible as well.
