XEfAExdBgD1flKdzoyOzGg.text: Was torn between the bacon wrapped tots and brussel sprouts for my appetizer. Ended up getting the brussels sprouts and was not disappointed one bit. Not sure they were worth the double digits they cost but I did love the bitter sprouts paired with the tangy, sweet apples. Still not sure how it was catagorized as an appetizer but I'm glad I ordered it. Had a piece of a dinner conpanion's Brie, Fig and Goat Cheese Flatbread and it was delicious! So I'm gonna have to come back again just to get that again and try thr tots.   I ordered the pork chop as an entree and it was flavorful perfection!   Definitely worth the stop in. I'm looking forward to my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork Chop
Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brussels with Pickled Apples

C3ur-9RmxHy06qdkoyqKyw.text: 2.5 stars  2 for service 3 for food  Our party of 8 was met with a scowl upon entering.  I can only assume it was Fran herself based on other reviews.  She seemed perturbed and said she had to go get it ready.  And also impolitely said to shut the door as we were entering.  We know it's cold but ask nicely! Kicker People: we had reservations!    Server was nice, maybe slightly talkative.  Very helpful in choices.  One party in group didn't get bread with their crab dip (luckily they had already in addition ordered a baguette).  Beers mixed up.  A lot of going in and out of our dining room to check this and that.   Food was fine.  I'm not sure anyone in our party will return.  Mussels special was great- I expected crostini to dip in the sauce;however, server did bring some garlic bread when requested.  Wedge was fine - nothing to write home about.  Appreciated the corn fresh as I could tell was cut off the cob.  My husband said lamb special was okay.  One patron did rave about the pasta he got (tomato based w sausage) so I would recommend that if going.

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Curry Mussels Appetizer Special
Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wedge

6HRZgwlIycM5uJ_0v3ubow.text: This was my first time trying Fran's and I was blown away. I've always known it existed and I had heard good things but hadn't tried it for whatever reason. I'm so glad I did and will be back often. I had the Asian Chicken Salad and it was one of the best salads I've ever had. We also had the calamari to start and it was incredible. Service was perfect and the owner is always on site making sure everyone is happy. Can't wait to go back!

muU_xGi97S0ecZx0buNYjQ.text: This place has been on my CLT bucket list since I moved here and I finally made it! My fiance and I came out on a warm Friday evening around 7:45 and there was no wait to be seated. We even asked to sit outside and there were plenty of options. The crowd on a Friday night was older and more relaxed than I would've expected, but it was relaxed and quiet, so I'm not complaining.   To drink, I ordered a gin-based cocktail with light citrus-y flavors (I forget the name unfortunately) but it was very refreshing and well-made.   To eat, my fiance and I started with the waffled corn bread with pimento cheese & pepper jelly. This is some of the best pimento I've ever had and it pairs super well with the cornbread and jelly. Highly recommend.  I then balanced out my meal with a very healthy Great Big salad. This is also one of the best salads I've ever had simply due to the variety of toppings that you don't normally see. It was a bed of mixed greens with beets, green beans, goat cheese, garbanzo beans, and sunflower seeds. I ordered the large (meal-sized) with their lemon vinaigrette, which was a great decision!  My fiance ordered the lamb burger which came highly recommended by our server and he was not disappointed. Yummy noises kept coming from across the table during the whole meal haha.

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great Big

I0IJnmaXQ5b3LYUqZRxN4g.text: After seeing Fran on a news-cooking segment, we cancelled our original plans and made our Valentine's Day dinner reservation at Fran's Filling Station. We've dined here once before and were pleased.  We were one of the first reservations of the night, so before it got too busy, Fran talked to others and us in the dinning room. Quickly things went down hill. The scallops and butternut squash risotto appetizer was one scallop cut in half. Disappointing. The salad was bitter. Disappointing. The lamb chops. Extra tough, fatty and unflavorful. Disappointing. As expected, they allowed me to order a different entree but it was cooked improperly and came out way after my husband was done with his entree. Disappointing. $150 plus tip later and we still got a pizza on the way home.

rJA3Y9bdJ6OiiAcF9RClNw.text: Very cute place for date night or just dinner with some friends! They have a great menu and honestly you could probably make a meal out of just eating their apps, they all look so good.  Don't miss the Brussels and the bacon wrapped tots, both are so so good!   For the mains, I ordered the crab cakes and they were superb! Comes with a very delicious slaw on the slide. Not overly filling but the perfect amount.  Also at our table the seared tuna and special of the day (I believe it was sirloin and potatoes) and both agreed their plates were equally delicious.   Need to come back on Wednesday when they have a special of burger + fries + a beer, sure can't beat that!

BV_YjSm2iqRCnDO9OgMyAQ.text: I thought of a cozy backyard get-together when I first walked in. It's super rustic, all the tables have real flowers! I've heard so many people say many good things about this place.   There were 3 servers when we came. It was a steady paced night. Let's start with appetizers! We ordered the fried green tomatoes and it had an unbelievably overpowering amount of goat cheese. The tomatoes were so thin, all I could taste was goat cheese and the jam they put on it. I got the chicken sandwich and it was fried to a crisp. Not the good crisp, the burnt kind where it makes the chicken dry and it tastes bitter. I loved the kale salad though!! I could eat plates of that.   Our table ordered a flatbread because it was the day's special. I believe they gave another table our flatbread and then realized they did so brought it back and we had to wait for them to bring it back out to us. There seemed to be a lot of confusion that night and a lot of mix ups with orders. The wait was also pretty long too for food. Wasn't overall impressed, but it could've just been an off night!

LWd2HpV7PrW7jzZZyvOLrQ.text: Let's start with the compliments, shall we? We had a pretty large party and we called shared to make reservations and people kept getting added but the staff handled it graciously and accommodated the extra guests well. The server and hostess or manager were professional and polite to our party which included a few of our friends who are deaf.   The food and drink were out fast. The fried green tomatoes were not your regular breaded fruit but had really flavorful toppings that made up for the lack of flavor in the breading and on the tomato itself. Think of it like the fried green tomato was a cracker and they topped it with fig jelly, cilantro or parsley, and feta.   I ordered the #8 with fries. The fries were fried in an oil that made them dark. They had little salt and so all I tasted was the oil. I asked for chips but, as they're house made, they bore the same result and they were limp when I got them. My friends got the potato soup and said it was really good, though.   The bread was crispy on the outside and soft in the middle, which I like but not nearly enough meat to balance how much bread and cheese I had in each bite. The sweet tea was not sweet at all so I'm thankful I had an Arnold Palmer as the lemonade gave it a little more sweetness.   The pricing wasn't bad. It's close to uptown and the wait was short.

m-sYdGoKVTp4oUtvNn7R-g.text: We've been to Fran's a couple of times, and wish we lived closer to take advantage of their weekday specials (like World Cuisine on Thursday).  But their regular menu has a few delicious staples that we'll always repeat, and they do have weekend specials as well.  We tried them during Restaurant Week, and they are only a good value if you get the more expensive items on the menu.  We prefer going during non-Restaurant Week, honestly.  It's less crowded, too.  We've tried several of the appetizers, and like their kale salad, bacon wrapped tots, and their cheesy bacon hush puppies (huge portion, but worth it, when they offer as a special).  I only wish they had more options without goat cheese and sweet sauces, because I'm not a fan of either.    Their meatballs are DIVINE.  We like them with the cheesy orzo (because, why not?).  You get two huge meatballs that taste like mine, so I'm betting they are made with beef, pork, and veal.  The orzo is cooked just right, and they are served with a tangy tomato sauce, melted mozzarella, and grated Parmesan.    Their crabcakes are very good as well.  They have very little filler, and are very filling.    Their burgers are also quite delicious.  They are served on a soft, extremely tasty pretzel roll, and you can choose your meat and style.  Recently, my husband ordered his burger medium-rare and it came out more medium, but it was still juicy and delicious.  You can choose fries, kale salad, or half of each as your side.  Whatever you choose, they aren't skimpy on the portions.  Their cocktails are a bit on the watery side (far too much ice!), and I'll likely get wine or water next time.  Fool me twice, you know?  They have a great beer selection, though.  We'll definitely keep returning!

mCl7kIT6O2D7_fpLf995Bg.text: We tried Frans after an article came out claiming it was highly underrated and it was True! I had never heard of it or noticed it despite living a couple blocks from it for 2 years. Upon arriving our server was very honest that they were much busier than usual and things would be slower than usual. To me, timing was just fine! Our server was so genuine, attentive, and funny. Our food was delicious, our favorite being the meatballs with orzo! Plenty of parking and there is indoor and outdoor seating. They take reservations and you can order pick up.

IGqIluyxTs1lvDi2adD_AA.text: I ate here a couple of weeks ago during a HUGE thunder and lightening storm...we sat outside and beside some heavy, drizzle-laden breezes, it was a great experience.  We started the meal with a good Pinot Noir and went right into the main courses(meatball and a huge salad).   Don't be fooled by the strip center facade...this place is legit!!!  Great food and friendly staff!!!

DRicn4-iTMMun1cCLz55Mw.text: This has been on my bucket list for a while. I came here for restaurant week. My husband called for a reservation and we got sat right away. We were near a window which was nice. The server was friendly. I got the tots and my husband got the mussels. Both were delicious.   After we got our appetizers, we waited a good 40 mins for our entrees. The server told us that the kitchen was backed up and apologized. No biggie. But when we got served our food, it was two completely different dishes. I got the meatball orzo and my hubs got the snapper. We were served chicken and something else. We told him it wasn't our order and the server looked confused. He took the food back and we waited again for our food. We were done eating our appetizers and saw a couple get sat. They got their appetizers and entrees all while we were waiting on our food. We finally got our food. We were both happy with our orders. The meatballs were delicious and soft. The orzo was cooked really well. My husband's snapper was very fresh and tasty.   Since we were there for a long time we decided to get our desserts to go. The server said he was sorry again for the confusion and the comped our appetizers. We got the check and saw that the order was put in wrong that's why we waited so long. Overall, it was a good experience. The food made up for it. We would definitely come back to try their regular menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Meatballs with orzo
Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Snapper
Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tater tots

muwZWJUBokYQsI5wwsmAIg.text: Well I can say that I truly got my fill at Fran's! A group of my fellow Yelp ladies and I came on a Monday evening during wine and tapas week and I wasn't sure what to expect portion-wise. When it comes to these promotional foodie weeks, I know a lot of restaurants like to tweak their normal offerings and portions. However, Fran's fully delivered on providing ample portions.  We arrived to a mostly empty restaurant, with only the front of the house being occupied. It's a deceptively big restaurant with two larger dining sections in the back. Big plus? No need to worry about parking because they share a large parking lot with the other stores in the shopping center.  I was quite tempted by a number of things on their wine & tapas week menu and made a last minute decision to go with the fried green tomatoes and bacon-wrapped sweet potato tots. I started off my meal with a petite syrah but was a little disappointed that it wasn't a tad colder.  Everyone placed their orders and then it felt like we waited for quite a while for the food to come out. Once it did, the plates came out in a staggered fashion. I'd read previous reviews and mostly everyone mentions the bacon wrapped tots. I was very pleased with them - sweet and easily poppable. They would be so good on top of a salad. Yup, a salad.  The fried green tomatoes were good but a little more sweet than I was expecting. I can't say that I would order those again. Since flatbreads were on special that night (they're $10 every Monday), I placed an order for the fig and goat cheese flat bread to-go. It is HUGE and I must say, it was even better warmed up the next day.  After months of having this place bookmarked, I'm so glad that I can report back on Fran's providing a delicious dining experience. I look forward to going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried green tomatoes with fig jam, pickled tomatoes, bacon &amp; goat cheese
Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon wrapped sweet potato tater tots

bOUxFFx483b6u0wer6ZFHA.text: Outstanding ! The bacon wrapped jalapeno Tater Tots were over the top!!!!!

6VJqthntBzXX06AqCUW1Dg.text: I ate lunch at Fran's last week for the first time and WOW! I'm going to be back again and again.  I like the eclectic menu, it's not the usual boring..... burger, some sort of chicken, some sort of fish, sandwich with some canned choices of a side dish. Oh No,  Fran's menu is pure innovation. My server was well versed with the specials of the day and gave great service.  I got the sense that they mix it up in there from day to day.    I had what they called a meatball slider and Madone was it good.  I had a side of Mac and Cheese (which I consider myself a M-&-C connoisseur)  Even the Mac and Cheese had a Fran twist that separates it from the pack using several shapes of pasta and a few different cheeses.  It was the best M-&-C I've ever had in Charlotte (including what used to be my favorites Lupie's and Mac's BBQ).  I was also impressed with the presentation. My ten dollar lunch was presented and garnished with the care, pride and attention like that of a Saturday Night, Uptown $50 Entree at the newest sheik place with a trendy one syllable name.   The tableware was really cool and retro styled (Melmac or Fiestaware like) very fitting of the charming-ness and uniqueness of Fran's.  Fran came out, introduced herself, welcomed me, asked what I thought and even gave me a couple of cookies.  How great is that?  In short, awesome menu, excellent service at a great value.  Should I become a serial killer (though not likely), get captured, found guilty and sentenced to the death penalty, I want my last meal to be Fran's Mac and Cheese.

kAZuxyhwR97s2JA0FuvzQA.text: Consistency in food quality is a hard thing to find. Fran keeps getting better. Great new dinner menu that includes a new "new south" burger (awesome) and a menu of pizzas that are fantastic to share. Even great for takeout. Fran can never disappoint!

hgHTn4ktJj4sgvK4FudnLA.text: Went for lunch with a friend. The service was great and all of the staff was professional and had a smile on their face. I got the No. 3 sandwich- Turkey with jezebel sauce (sweet & spicy apricot) melted brie, and apples (served hot) with a side of deviled eggs. SO good. Will definitely be going back.

KQP2TchGCKZILvVhWZmn_g.text: If I were just reviewing the food, I would give more stars, but since I couldn't separate the food from the whole experience, I have to give Fran's a "medium."     I walked into Fran's, which is cute enough, and was immediately overwhelmed by the smell of ginger. SO WEIRD!  I spent the rest of my time there (and truthfully much of the rest of the day) wondering what the heck made the place smell so strange. Was it a candle? If so, "Bad Fran! No smelly candles near food!"   Was it something in the kitchen (what sandwiches have ginger in them?)? Perhaps they  were brewing up a big pot of ginger tea somewhere (Which is totally disgusting).    My sandwich was good (included what looked like home-made bacon!), and the potato salad was very good.  It was refreshing to experience a mayo-based potato salad that actually had flavor and wasn't overly mayo'd.   I may go back.  And hopefully I won't leave with that ginger smell in my hair again.   PS I hate ginger!

JhqzCKdv-Fgfg3vGgE5dTQ.text: Maybe we hit it on an off night?  We'd heard so many great things about Fran's... especially their veggie burger.  So, we finally decided to go give it a try.    I was totally thrown off when we walked in the place.  It was very nice... almost too nice... especially considering the name.  And likewise, the prices were very nice.  Much more than we expected for a "filling station" but we'd talked about giving it a try for so long we decided to splurge.  After viewing the menu, I was so intrigued by the blue corn meal crusted calamari, that I decided to skip out on the veggie burger, and ordered the calamari and the "best fries in Charlotte".  The calamari was super super salty and sort of soggy.  Not very appetizing.  I tried to flake off the corn meal crust but it was stuck on, along with all the salt.  Between 2 of us we couldn't even finish them and they were just an appetizer size.  The fries were okay, but I wouldn't say "the best".    The best part of the veggie burger (which Ben still ordered as planned) was the special carrot relish/salad.  But the actual burger wasn't that great and fell apart with the slightest touch.  Overall we were pretty disappointed and most likely won't be back to give it another go.

IS2ZgjG3V3DlO-ygmLQwfA.text: Excellent! We're continuing to make our way through some of Charlotte's best restaurants and yesterday was Fran's turn. Fran herself was ever-present offering recommendations and making sure everyone enjoyed their food...and did we ever! When every diner orders a different dish and each is better than the next you know you've stumbled on a culinary gem. I enjoyed Fran's famed meatballs, my fiance enjoyed the lamb burger, and his parents loved the salmon and butternut squash lasagna. The atmosphere was casual yet sophisticated and they had my favorite California Chardonnay (Sonoma Cutrer), and a yummy Malbec on the wine list. We will definitely be back!

ecPImUFeRIyvmv2N7Tv_Lg.text: Absolutely one of my favorite places in Charlotte. It's a fantastic neighborhood restaurant worth driving across town for. It's small and homey with Fran herself checking up on her guests and refilling drinks.  The menu is full of tasty options. The bacon-wrapped tater tots are as good as their name would suggest, the fried chicken sandwiches are some of the best I've ever had, and the bowl of meatballs--yes, a bowl of meatballs--are amazing. But the real stars here are the specials. Each night has a theme and an appropriate dish, as well as whatever Fran decides to send out.  Definitely a place worth checking out and a True Charlotte gem.

jKGmqDQusqmCJq721ujFxw.text: My buffalo chicken was good, and I enjoyed the pretzel bun. The spinach was ok, but the garlic was burnt.   My friend got the veggie burger, which was more of a veggie puree served on a bun. She was less than thrilled with it.  The bread pudding was really dry (to the point where I wondered if they screwed up the recipe) and was highly "meh".   Our server was very friendly and attentive.

2oHVgxVrs1gWumD2h6kE1A.text: Fabulous food and a wonderful staff.     We just had a business dinner for our team at Fran's. We planned the menu ahead of time and it was served family style.  The service was impeccable and the food was out of this world.  Every course was beautifully plated.  The flavor combinations, freshness of ingredients and labor of love came shinning through with every bite.     There is something for everyone at Fran's.  Her recipes are extra special.  I am passionate about food.  You have to experience it for yourself and you will be hooked.    I highly recommend calling Fran to cater parties at your home or to host at the restaurant.  There is no other caterer who will care more about delivering the best possible meal for you and your guests.

TAjvvMecdiTBpBnDp-KBKw.text: Bacon wrapped tator tots.  'Nuff said.  I love tots.  And I love bacon.  Put the two together and I'm a happy girl!  Aside from the tots, Fran's offers a nice menu with great dishes.  You can't go wrong when dining at Fran's!

YDZEi2H96S2rQdySN4Vb9g.text: Have you ever sat on the john for a little r/r (rest and release, that is) before lunch and thought out loud "God, I really want a good salad?" Having a predilection for salads that are 1.) good and 2.) unique, Fran's had exactly what I was looking for in a lunch. I got the special: grilled vegetable salad with corn off the cob, squash, zucchini, red onions, potatoes and more. Gratuitous amount of vegetables, not heavy handed on just the greens the way a salad should be. Completely delicious with the lemon vinaigrette. Filling without weighing me down. Ya gotta go.

qZ9lNks7LLRSkyM9p9yp7w.text: Fran!!!! That was my version of a shout out. This menu is full of so much good comfort food that it's hard to decide every time I go. Only 10 or so small tables in the restaurant, but no worries, I feel at home at the bar ordering from there and watching whatever on the one TV in the joint.   Fried pickles, bacon wrapped tater tots, burgers, "thanksgiving dinner", amazing salads and homemade desserts...the list continues. This is one of my favorite restaurants in town and I continue to brings friends and family here each time they visit.   Make sure you talk to Fran when you're there as she's always walking the tables are standing at the end of the bar throwing out her recommendations for the day. I end up always listening and enjoying everything that comes out of the kitchen.

hERQFkGlDS4yHIxjBRmopA.text: We had  simple catering for an office , boxed lunches and beautiful salads. Everyone was so  happy. Cookies were still warm. Fresh, flavorful, fantastic. It made lots of new fans, can't wait to go to the restaurant.

erBNUIbdROgKn_Zj1Vsvog.text: Get the Parmesan garlic fries they are delicious. I have been here twice for lunch with my mom and we both got the build your own sandwich. She gets the roast beef which she raves about and I do a build your own veggie sandwich with avocado. The lemon aioli really makes the sandwich a standout. A great pic for veggies and meat eaters alike!

tTchkYBObz3LmB91tSlmMw.text: I have been to Fran's for lunch, dinner and even just drinks and appetizers. Every time I have  been impressed. The funky and higher casual vibe is welcoming as you walk in. The staff are relaxed and knowledgeable. You can tell the food is fresh, hand-crafted and made with love. So nice to find a small business with great food that is not a chain! I also like how Fran puts news on her Facebook feed so I know when her meatloaf is ready for me to drive on over...

ntVxwYouilQr1eFd1bpmKA.text: We arrived at 2:30 on a Saturday.  Apparently this is not the time to arrive. They shut off all their deep fryers apparently to get ready for dinner.  Lets just say 3/4 of the menu is deep fried.  This limited our options to salad and two sandwiches.The sandwich was decent, the waiter was awesome, but I after going through the menu and having to settle well it plain out sucked. I would love to come back and try the food another time as it appeared to be good ( thanks table behind us), but I wish I would have known that the menu would be downsized from 2:30 - 5.

mavApygzHAoqBTqjv4bOeA.text: This was our 2nd time visiting, we found the menu lacking choices.  The service was good from the temporary bartender & another waiter that wasn't ours.  Our appetizers came out quickly, but the entrees took longer than expected.   We were given a free appetizer of tots to make up for it.  Once we got our food it was tasty, although the salmon was slightly overcooked.  I found the food to be overpriced for the portion size.  Example, $10 for 12 tater tots.

5aPwc4JUQlKpg2h7qMr_1w.text: The staff was super nice as was the owner. She was very involved in her business which is really cool. The food was awesome and they had awesome craft beers on special! Definitely will return next time I'm in charlotte.

vyX5GwIFL8BKu9OWX0PRpg.text: good food, but they seem chronically understaffed.  If you want good, quick service, sit at the bar; otherwise you should plan to stay a while.  Doesn't seem to be the fault of the waiters and waitresses, they are friendly enough, there just aren't enough of them.

-x9_FqhgZrYEEyKTHPQ9-g.text: The services was great for Summer Resturant Week 2016. The server was knowledgeable of the menu and provided great feedback to our questions. The food was fantastic. The kale salad with the Lamb burger. The restaurant was clean and quiet which helped keep the conversation at the table perfect.

4ZJ0EfNqdVSsK-89ro4roQ.text: We've been a few times and we always say we should go back more often. We should! Fran's went through a renovation recently that has really enhanced the look and feel of the restaurant; the bar in particular.  The service has been consistently great and the food is always excellent. The menu is a mix of their traditional sandwiches along with some great appetizers and substantial main plates. It's not just a lunch place, dinner too! There is always a special and the dishes are creative. I always order their corn fritter appetizer; very tasty and you won't find something similar locally. And check our their bacon wrapped tater tots!   Overall a great experience to enjoy a great meal and a neighborhood gem  **** As an update we went back - twice; once for lunch and once for dinner. For lunch I had their winter BLT. Quite possibly the best sandwich I've ever had. They use a basil pesto with roasted tomatoes and of course bacon. A superb flavor combination.   At dinner, I did the specials all the way. That evening they had a short-rib appetizer garnished with crispy onions ... So very good. Absolute compliments to the kitchen interns of preparation. I then had bacon and Brussels sprout flatbread. While not advertised - they added a little mustard, which added so much to the flavor.

VlhC6gGqh_h6sr-zmg1kKw.text: This place is excellent for dinner with your main squeeze or a girls night or even an after work snack! Fresh, creative food and a beautiful bar I will definitely come back again and again! Fran made sure my meal was everything I needed and what a doll!

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mahi tacos and a NODA free will

1A-zTD5V_WojsrXdo8eXFQ.text: Had lunch on Saturday. Server was knowledgeable about the menu, friendly and proficient. Couldn't pass up the bacon tots and they were delicious. I had the Thanksgiving sandwich and it was quite enjoyable.

je2cEjE_4F85L7qIzJl-Nw.text: The food was pretty good but the service was awful. We were put in a side room that was incredibly cold and cramped. Our waiter struggled to get to our table. We had to repeatedly ask for refills, rarely were we asked if we needed anything. The whole waitstaff looked disorganized. We will not be returning.

DHLkIoAj2ai_XLoCgb0VWw.text: Last night was my second time there. Great food, drinks, and excellent service!! If you haven't been you should go. You won't be disappointed!

_4vVc3N5Dk-d0GnATm_RmA.text: Fran Scahbeli Hits another home run with her restaurant, Fran's Filling Station.   The menu is enticing from its first appetizer to the last dessert item.  Fran's fried pickles with its scrumptious dipping sauce are nothing short of addictive.   The sloppy burger is akin to the delicious one your grandfather grilled for you as a kid. The freshest tomato, onion, and delicious cheese adorn these massive burgers.  Fran's bread is the best in the Queen City!  Her salads are fresh and delicious.   Indoor and outdoor seating is available.  Convenient parking is available, as well.  Outstanding place to eat lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States

n9nJxUk0LI-nAqE6eRrsnQ.text: Great choice as I was passing through Charlotte. Service was excellent and our food came out quickly too. You can't go wrong with the menu choices. We started with cornbread waffles with pimento cheese and pepper jelly. Also had their lamb burger, the pretzel bun was homemade with a delicious sauce, came with kale salad and fries. The desserts sounded delicious but we were stuffed. Large burgers!! Prices maybe a bit high, but the freshness and quality made our meals worth the price. We did not have an alcoholic beverage but many choices in beer, wine and mixed drinks. Plenty of parking available as well. Definitely a gem!

R5Kq7yU6q7cC792BAt9LFQ.text: Both the veggie burger and the pan roasted chicken were very good. I liked that the burger came with fries and a kale salad - both of which were not small. Service was pretty good. The restaurant was a little nicer than I was expecting, but in a good way. I will come back!

HZbMEJtpqrPI5Vd4iNHd-A.text: Terrible experience. Brought my foot out 20 min before husbands food. Finally brought his salmon out.  My veggie burger got very cold waiting for his food to arrive. They need to get their act together.

xaw9i0nY9-kH1i1_ZmDITw.text: Lot's of interesting choices on the menu and they feature a different special everyday.. Today's special was a chilli cheeseburger with mozzarella cheese on a pretzel bun and a side item. I chose the fries and gladly paid an extra $1 to add parmesan garlic to them. It was messy and sooo good. The burger was so big I couldn't finish all the fries. Eva waited on me and you can tell she enjoys working there and she knows the menu by heart.  I  highly recommend this place and I plan to go back and try several more items on the menu.

mbf4e5ahhdjTRoX7NQcR-Q.text: Yummy, comfort food!  I like that the owner, Fran, has a strong presence there. The times I've gone she interacts with the patrons, helps her servers, or is relaxing at the bar. It's nice to see her so involved!  The food is tasty. If you are a vegetarian, or limit meat eating (like me), there are really only two entrees, not counting salads: veggie burger, eggplant parmesan. The fried corn poppers are sweet and pair well with ranch dressing!  The atmosphere varies depending on the crowd. I envision Fran's as an intimate, yet casual dining area with a laid-back staff...but get the place full and it becomes a very loud, slightly chaotic place with servers running from one table to the next. Perhaps it was due to a really busy week at work and I was tired, but watching the hustle and bustle from the servers made me feel a tad anxious rather than being able to relax during dinner. In addition, one of my requests was forgotten and I felt rushed when speaking to my server (for instance, I felt it would take a while for our server to return, so I asked for a box and the check in one breath and had my credit card in hand to give over).    Overall, each time I've stopped in I've had good food and a pretty good time. It's a pretty popular place and definitely one to check out!

kTFWWaiVkxTrGzPwVMYvww.text: This place was one of the best lunches I've had in Charlotte. Got the sloppy burger and it was to die for. I'm telling you... the flavor, the bun, the tender meat, and the thick cut pickles on top made my dreams of finding the perfect burger come True. The fries were equally good.. some of the best in town.

1LM0U9zppL-9z-g4HoXNeg.text: Disappointed to hear great reviews only to show up for dinner to find this place closed with no note on the door and no message on the number listed for the place.  Bummer.

CWV5fqWkVvE7zPhuFdTdEA.text: We went on a Saturday night for the bacon tots, but they didn't have them.  Tried ordering two beers, and they were out of both.  Ordered a side as a starter... they were out of that too! We left. Sad state of affairs for 7p.

_G7yFNXC2ccBhzafOxsBPQ.text: Great food!  Had the Glazed Salmon special with terrific Brussels sprouts.  Highly recommend this as an entree.  Our waitress, Tamara, was spread extremely thin over what appeared to be the entire front portion of the restaurant, but handled everything with ease.    Thanks for a great first-time experience!

A7l_JcLaldgYDFbetyibOA.text: A group of us traveled to Charlotte for a long weekend.  We decided to go to Fran's because it was close to one of the events we were attending.  The place is a little small but that adds to its charm and quaintness.  The inside of the restaurant is much nicer than the strip mall exterior and "filling station" name would lead you to believe.  As well, the food and service is much better also.  Because of the size of the restaurant it can be difficult for the business to handle large parties.  However, we called ahead to let them know we were coming.  They seated us in a back room that was just large enough to handle our group of 18.  We did have to sit at separate tables but this actually worked out well.  Our waitress was knowledgeable and very friendly, even though we ran her to death.  The group got a variety of items from the mussels to the brisket, and everyone enjoyed their meals.  Even with a large group all the meals came out pretty quickly and very close together.  No one was left waiting while others were eating!  Kudos to the chef and owner/manager.  We highly recommend Fran's Filling Station for a delicious meal.

9mGsRsyQm5K1QkZmVetsqQ.text: We went there tonight for the 2nd Saturday in a row. Both visits were excellent. Tonight we went with friends and had a great experience. The food was phenomenal- the mussels appetizer was out of this world, and the red snapper with lemon orzo was perfection. We each got a different dessert, and there wasn't a morsel left on any plate. Our server was knowledgeable and attentive. This is definitely my new favorite place.

la1cqZFEDwUl8h-SDi6UJA.text: Bart was bummed out at work today, and he wanted a sandwich. But not just any run of the mill mid-week office lunch hour sandwich - he wanted a True to life sandwich experience. There was no doubt where we'd find this. I said, "Fran's." Squirreled away inconspicuously at the corner end of the Park Square shopping center in Dilworth, Fran's Filling Station is an unfortunately all-too-often overlooked lunch spot in the greater Park Road area. Surrounded by so many mediocre options in that area that our coworkers are so often complacently willing to settle on - Jason's Deli, McAlister's, Which-Wich, Penn Station, etc. - I felt in Bart's diminished mood, he needed a trip to the glorious little hovel of good food that is Fran's.  Not ones to adhere to a conventional businessday lunch hour, we strolled in around 11:15am. There was no one else in the dining room, just a pair of waitresses leaning delicately across the blocked-wood bar, fingers intertwined, elbows crooked and pressed upon, faces plain yet subtly eager with start-of-the-day malaise.  Bart had never been to Fran's. He gestured an approving curl of his lower lip. "Hmmmmph," he said.  I nodded. "Yep." The waitresses greeted us charmingly, as they're apt to do. Fran's isn't a hoity establishment. It's a classic southern cafe, done up in folksy art, hand-painted table tops under heavy lacquer, fresh flower bouquets, etched wood carvings, and clever 60s/70s era pop art adorning the brick walls. You feel like you're all friends there, like you're all in this together, like you just walked onto the set of Fried Green Tomatoes or something.  Our waitress came over, smiling wide, a gorgeous creature, tall and well-shaped, broad shoulders and hips, a strong core, thin neck and soft cheeks, long brown pony swinging playfully behind her like a mane. I eased back in my chair, stuffed my fingers in my pockets, and stretched a tight-lipped grin. "What are you guys drinking?" she asked.  I glanced at Bart and his frumpish scowl, then down at the menus our waitress was placing before us. I cocked my head as a wily thought entered: beer. I nudged Bart and chinned toward the bar. "What ARE we drinking?" I asked.  Bart's scowl lifted into an illuminated beam. "Whoah..." he eased out in a breath of unanticipated joy. "They have great beers..." Bird Song, Southern Tier, Natty Greene's, wine, liquor, more beer. The waitress saw us eyeing the bar and let out a little chortle. "Do you guys want a beer list?" she asked. "We don't usually get many people ordering beer at 11am on a Wednesday."  We shrugged incredulously. That notion just seemed silly.  We each opted for a Southern Tier IPA, and then our marvelously-built waitress left us to our perusing of the menu. As we were reading through the mind-blowing list of fried appetizers, decadent salads, opulent burgers, and mouth-wateringly descriptive signature sandwiches, I recognized the opening horns of Born to Run floating down from the overhead speakers. "Springsteen," I acknowledged aloud, forefinger pointed to the sky. Bart nodded approvingly.  "Chrome-wheeled, fuel-injected, and steppin' out ov-er the liiine," I sang. "HOoo-whoooahhh!" I rapped my thumbs sideways across the slick wood finish of the table and stamped my heels into the flat of the cement floor.  Our waitress returned with our beers, her own mood clearly lifted by the good time Bart and I were starting to have. She took our orders. I went with the number 4 - a chicken salad sandwich with lemon aioli, avocado, and pickled red onion strings. Bart ordered the Reuben, and we each chose the farmhouse style cottage cheese as our side. "And another beer?" she asked before leaving. We smiled and nodded.  Springsteen ended and we both paused with bated breath for what might come next. The opening chords rang out and we both lit up - Alanis Morissette! But not You Oughta Know or Ironic or even All I Really Want... Nope, it was m-f'in Head Over Feet. I belted out, "Are you kidding me right now?" Bart nodded approvingly.  "You've al-ready w'ON mee ooo-varr... in-spite uv meee," we sang in gorgeous, baritone harmony. "So don't be al'ARMED if I faa-aall... hyead ov-ar feeet." Our food arrived with our second beers - beautifully stacked trays of tall sandwiches, mounded with meat and sauce, overflowing cups of seasoned and garnished cottage cheese, face-fuming aromas of spice and dough and dairy, like a farm, like a fable. We stuffed our mouths, silly and contented,  avocado glaze speckling my beard, napkins ruined, shirts spotted, beer spilled and lyrics slurred ignominiously to every tune soaring above us.  We ordered another beer, had our leftovers boxed, and cleaned up our ridiculous Wednesday mess. When our trim waitress returned with the check, Bart fumbled around under his ass for a moment, face locked in embarrassment and concern. "I don't have my wallet..."   I laughed. "Don't sweat it; this one's on me." Bart finished the rest of his day in a fantastic mood.

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. The number 4.
Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Southern Tier IPA @ Fran&#39;s

DRT3n39jBQfRWCf_eNS9mg.text: This definitely one of the neighborhood secrets of Charlotte. Must Go To.   It is a little tricky to find but well worth the adventure. I always get the California style burger with havarti cheese and avocados (amazing combination). Must try right here!!!!!  This is great, Fran and team are exceptionally nice and the it is a True pleasure to visit. I have been back several times since and they have never disappointed.  Best, -Wally

oES-LOzQr6vPmdkJyYZddw.text: My only complaint is that their french fries are too good. I always go with the intention of ordering their really excellent salads but as I am sitting checking out the menu I am also checking out the plates on the surrounding tables and  every time those french fries call my name and I order one of their great sandwiches that come with the best french fries around. My two most recent experiences were their excellent lamb burger and their BLT sandwich. They do some sort of seasoning/dressing on their sandwich which is just outstanding. The only reason they do not get five stars is that if I gave them five what would I give Barringtons. Aix, Lumiere, etc

MIP0Km3-S8xf6k5tMyc8cQ.text: I came  in with my family.. . the atmosphere was great.  Brian my server was nice.  Then is all goes down hill.  My daughter's glass was disgusting and her Sprite was flat.. I could have dealt with that but when I bit into my turkey burger and bit into a plastic wrapper (2/3 inch in diameter).I was horrified. It was absolutely disgusting!!! When telling the active manger on duty about this she acted like it was not big deal!!.  I would never eat here again and they are very lucky my child was not the one to bite into the wrapper!!!!! Stay away!!!!

i6YNZS_fq31pJ7SILSRxAg.text: Lovely setting. Very busy on Saturday but we arrived soon after they opened and grabbed a table. There was a mixture of families and couples. I find the menu to be a bit pricey for dinner, based on the portions and type of food. We had a round of drinks, and the combo bacon wrapped tator tots to start. I could decide if I prefer the regular or sweet potato tots! My husband ordered the chicken pesto flatbread, which was quite bland and nothing exciting. I had the Latin wedge with grilled chicken. The salad was amazing, so much flavor! I look forward to going back for lunch and enjoying the Latin wedge again.

8yWjf-iBz4zVFZ7EOs_m0w.text: Fran's has been on our restaurants-to-try list for awhile, and we're so glad we did! Our group loved everything we had, starting with maple bacon wrapped tater tots.  The bacon was perfectly cooked and crispy, and the maple glaze added sweetness to balance the salty.  Yes they are sticky, but it's maple syrup! Our entrees included chicken Parmesan, gooey meatballs for the kids, chicken sandwiches, and my Moroccan veggie burger. Our sides included the mac & cheese and Brussels sprouts--yum! Desserts we tried were the chocolate cake and coconut cake. Everyone LOVED the food, and our server was great.  We went at 6:30 on a Saturday night, and by the time we left the place was packed.  We won't hesitate to take more friends for the fabulous food!

photos.caption: Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Moroccan veggie burger with feta--yummmm!
Photo of Fran's Filling Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Maple glazed bacon wrapped tater tots!

M0rG1or51kDnQF8WMoCLEA.text: My most recent dinning experience here was my third or fourth time at this restaurant. Every other time I have been here I LOVED it. I especially love the wrapped bacon tots appetizer. Delicious and innovative. So, although this is not a restaurant I frequent often, I had such warm feelings toward it.   My last dinning experience leaves me feeling like I will never come back. Let's start with where I started that evening.  I ordered a new cocktail that they had on the menu. It was a lemonade cocktail that literally tasted like water with about a few lemons in it . No taste of alcohol. Lacking in flavor.   The tater tots, per usual, were superb!!!!!!!!!!! The best of the meal.   As I looked on the entree menu, I was very disappointed that they have scaled back some of the best dishes. Have no clue where they went but they need to bring them back. Settled on the Old School Burger.   This burger only rivals a burger you could get at your local Chili's. Such a travesty at $17.00. Just terrible. There was nothing special about this burger. And this supposed secret sauce that they advertise, well, I didn't taste any sauce.   To put the icing on the cake. My dinner companion had an issue where she was charged an uncharge when she shouldn't have been and one for which the waiter failed to tell her that she would be charged. When having the owner, Fran, come over. She handled herself in a disgusting manner. She told my friend, that avocados are very expensive and that's what the uncharge was. Never a real apology. She made both of us feel uncomfortable with her aggressiveness. The uncharge was around $1.25. We could have bought an entire avocado for that. The owner was so busy telling us the change in price for avocados. Not our problem lady. Make sure your staff is trained properly so they can simply communicate these things. The issue was not the amount but rather the customer service.   Terrible. Such a waste of what use to be a perfection type restaurant.

siPFoG6EMtyGzRKKvol_Fg.text: I have some dietary restrictions and they were completely inflexible. We sat down, ordered wine and left right after because I was unable to order a single thing off their menu. And they weren't so nice about it either.

U9aIIUBn7nzgjtO0lr3FXw.text: This place has a nice variety of foods. Their food is fresh and creatively prepared. There is a nice bar in the restaurant as well. I enjoyed a salad with grilled salmon. The salmon was cooked to perfection. I will definitely return to try more dishes.

x9FwFNz_0-VX44BKy6lFsg.text: Everything we've ever gotten here as been absolutely delicious. The service is great, we've never had to wait, and the food- oh, MY. to die for.

CGOnI3F0gj4fhUnEZmffag.text: Bacon-wrapped Tater Tots? Shut the front door! Don't skip the bread pudding. Fantabulous!

d6JYZyF8UWW6xE48C_IHHw.text: My friends and I went here for the first time for restaurant week and it was SO good!  I had the tenderloin skewers which came with Caesar salad and fries. Pretty much all my favorite things all on one plate!  We also tried the much talked about tots...they were good, but I'm not much of a "sweets" person so the coating was a little more than I'd like, but still good and I chowed them down!  The flatbreads and meatballs also looked so amazing!  Can't wait to go back!  Service and food was even better than we expected...especially when they were busy with restaurant week.

QoGcqaxDIUsHUX-h7fNfcA.text: Just had such a strange experience here--came with a group and the service left a lot to be desired.  However, the bigger issue had to do with cleanliness/etiquette.  Fran herself was delivering our food to our table and my salad had spilled off the side of the plate a bit.  As she was putting the food down in front of me, she goes "oh sorry about that" and proceeds to take her BARE FINGER to push the salad off the edge and more into the plate.  Salad was overpriced and I obviously didn't end up eating much of it because I was so grossed out.  I regret not saying anything, but it occurred to me that if she is this comfortable handling food with her bare hands literally right in front of customers, who knows what they do in the kitchen.

QtKCtZujJYqex6vZb7xmCA.text: Awkward service, lame menu with even worse ambiance and a nicely prepared burger. This is the restaurant that your weird aunt opens when your uncle leaves her an insurance settlement.   Not good for vegetarian wife, I was not interested in their attempts at creative entrees.   Fair to above average choices for draft beer, did not notice cocktails (would not trust a bartender who wouldn't have left this middling restaurant in the first place)  Charlotte needs enticing, come-as-you-are dining... Fran's aims to do this and whiffs.

TXEMkuZrYJKFeb7tsyPIvg.text: Fran's Filling Station is one of my fiance's and my favorite spots to go for a romantic dinner. The ambience inside the restaurant is just perfect for us, and the food is terrific! I highly recommend the mussels with butter & white wine sauce, but truly you can't go wrong with any of the dishes here! The staff is incredibly knowledgeable and very kind, and I love that they are so accommodating. They seem to always remember our preferences and they have provided us with specialized meals more than once.  Excellent service, atmosphere and food!! Highly recommended!

naH3v7APc12akfhWsgprnw.text: Delicious lunch spot! I ordered the turkey apple sandwich with apricot glaze on a baguette and it was out of this world. Also very fresh ingredients. The service was relatively quick for quality food. With three people the bill came to about $23 which is reasonable!

PchLWuh_tGWysXOnWcrrvQ.text: YUM...sitting in Portofino's one evening, another lady at the bar and I got to chatting about good desserts.  She mentioned Fran's and advised I try it.  Well, I went for lunch on Saturday.  The food was very good, can't wait to get back to try dinner.  We ordered the Southern Fried Chicken sandwich on wheat, and the #1 Turkey sandwich.  The fries were good too.  The potato salad and deviled eggs had a lot to be desired, but the sandwiches were great. We were too full to try dessert, will try on my next visit though.  Also will try the bacon wrapped tater tots.  The sweet tea was nasty!  Boo.

WSEKkCTvBcxyZ9oFA3aZpw.text: This is Fran's second time working with our meetup group to accomodate a large party. The back room was set up for our party of 12. We started with drinks by the bar, made by a very attentive bartender. Then we migrated to the back room where our server, Katie, got us all waters and took our drink order. I recommend the bacon wrapped potatoe puffs for an appetizer. Others in my party ordered kale salads they say were tasty. For entree: the Fran's meatballs on orzo (you could also get it on kale). YUMMY! Others in my party enjoyed the fish tacos and salmon entree. Fran stopped in a few times to make sure we were doing well. Katie had everything under control! Excellent service.

QfqXcC66yFmPK0EPewcNBQ.text: Hot Chips Made to Order!  Just figuring out the Menu (I can NOT Read Menus) and embarrassed that I have never eaten here, so I ask questions, because the Menu says Chips... I STOP and want to know are they Hot and Made-to-order or are they bagged ? ? ?  My Waitress says, "They are HOT and Made-to-order" so I only need to decide what I would like to go with them : How about : Jalapeno Slaw Vinegar Based! Create your own Sandwich : Roast Beast Sandwich!    The Chips were EXAKT!  Super Thinly Sliced, lightly Deep fried, not Crispy, yet still approaching light golden, lightly salted PERFEKT!  Did not need any ranch or even the most tempting Sauce I would have ignored!!!!!  These were so FANTASTIK!  to say I'm a Fan would be a gross understatement, I'm a Franatik!  Create My Own Sandwich sounds like a plan and it was a Masterpiece that might heal some Mental illness (it Healed me) : Here it is: Hot Roast Beef, melted Havarti, Cold Tomatoes, Super thinly Sliced RED Onions (great work) on a Warm (bet it was House Made) Bread (hope the Photos turned out!  This Sandwich is nominate for some Rod0 Awards!  After eating this wonderful food I had just enough Brain Power to search the Menu (I heard some people talking about SWEET Potato CHIPS) Oh I should have Ordered the Sweet Potato Chips ! ! !  So I did!  They were Very Good, should have been Hotter, still Very Good!  Jalapeno Slaw Vinegar Based... a Total Disappointment (back to the Drawing Board)!  If I still lived in Charlotte I would Eat Here so much they would be naming Food after me!

CBXffUdaxJvJCiJ3sXjKOA.text: I used to love this place, but they ruined the menu when they revamped it.  All they have for a dinner menu is sandwiches, a salmon salad, spaghetti, and Fran's meatballs.  Sad!  They took off the best thing they had...  Bring back the Chicken Milanese!!  I probably won't be back because all the good food on the menu has disappeared, sadly.

ppIoh584_Bmc3nOoNPl0YA.text: Things have changed for better at Fran's! The food has always been delicious, but now the service rocks too. They've hired more servers and expanded the dining area in addition to giving the place a fresh coat of paint and new lighting.  I'm so glad we gave Fran and her awesome crew another chance. We now come here a few times each month and couldn't be more pleased.  Our menu favs: the beef skewers, burgers, fig goat cheese flatbread, butternut squash lasagna, Brussels sprouts, and pretty much any of the daily specials.

AsDb_MhGrWGTFEfO0eNTxg.text: scrumptious!! So glad we stopped in for lunch. Had to get the bacon wrapped tater tots, worth ever calorie. Then on to the new south fried chicken sandwich for me and the buffalo fried chicken for my date. Both were perfect, beautifully fried chicken, moist, but super crispy on the outside.  Superb and understated service by our waiter. Will visit again if we ever get back to Charlotte.  Highly recommend, spot on!
